Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ‚Äì Financial Services

Madrid, Spain - office based work.

Full-Time




About the Company:




My client are a leading financial services firm based in Madrid, dedicated to providing innovative financial solutions to a diverse range of clients. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. If you are passionate about working with data in the financial sector and want to be a key part of our growth, we want to hear from you!




Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis: Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets related to financial markets, investment portfolios, trading, and economic indicators.
Financial Insights: Provide actionable insights by analyzing market trends, financial products, and client data to support decision-making processes.
Reporting: Develop and maintain automated dashboards and reports to present key financial metrics and trends to stakeholders.
Modeling & Forecasting: Support the development of predictive models, risk assessments, and forecasting tools to enhance investment strategies.
Collaboration: Work closely with teams across trading, risk management, and finance to ensure data-driven decision-making and business alignment.
Compliance & Accuracy: Ensure data integrity and comply with industry regulations, ensuring accuracy in all reporting and analysis.




Qualifications:




Education: A Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Data Science from a top-tier university either globally or within Spain (e.g., Universidad de Barcelona, Universidad Aut√≥noma de Madrid, IE University, or similar).

Experience:




A minimum of 2-3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst within the financial services industry (e.g., investment banks, asset management, trading, financial technology).
Solid understanding of financial data, including equity, bonds, derivatives, and market behavior.




Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and Python or R.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with financial data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to synthesize complex financial data into clear insights.
Fluent in English (both written and spoken); proficiency in Spanish is a plus.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for career advancement and professional development.
A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
The chance to work with cutting-edge financial technologies.

Full-Time


About the Company:


My client are a leading financial services firm based in Madrid, dedicated to providing innovative financial solutions to a diverse range of clients. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data analyst

Your Role And Work Environment

We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Human Connection Strategy Team of Human Connection tribe.

If you are passionate about turning data into actionable insights and enjoy working directly with stakeholders to influence strategic decisions, this role is for you.

We are seeking someone who, in additions to being technically proficient, can translate complex data insights into clear business recommendations, communicate effectively with non-technical audiences, and contribute to driving key initiatives within the organization.

Your Key Responsibilities

As a Data analyst you will:


Translate data into insights that inform strategic and operational decisions across the business.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, co-create analytical approaches, and present results in a way that drives action.
Prepare and deliver high-impact presentations and data-driven narratives for senior leadership and cross-functional teams.
Bridge the gap between data and business, ensuring insights are understandable and actionable.
Collaborate with other teams in an International and agile environment, ensuring alignment and consistent communication.


What are we looking for?

Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!

Knows About

For us, a Data analyst is someone who:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business, Engineering, or similar.
3-4 years of experience in data analytics, business analytics, consulting, or related roles.
Solid knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., power BI, Tableau) python or R is a plus but not essential.
Strong experience in data storytelling and creating business presentations.
Fluent English (spoken and written)
Understanding of business strategy and kpis to connect data insights with tangible business outcomes


Can


Communicate complex data insights clearly and persuasively to non-technical stakeholders.
Proactively identify opportunities where data can add value and influence key decisions.


Loves To


Collaborate in multidisciplinary teams, contributing to both technical and strategic conversations.
Present and defend your ideas with confidence and openness to feedback.


Defines Himself/herself As a


A team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Flexible, dynamic, and eager to work in fast-paced changing environments.


What do we offer?

The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.

Check out what is waiting for you!

Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues‚Äô needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.

Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.

Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!

Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).

Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.

Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶

Free Company Shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.

Banking Benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!

More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+), Leonas & RI√ëG.

International Remote work program.

Get to know Us

We are a team of more than 1700 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.

A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.

And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.

We are proud to have a diverse team, and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.

And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.

Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

___________________________________________________________

En ING buscamos un/a analista de datos

Su Funci√≥n y Entorno De Trabajo

Estamos buscando un analista de datos talentoso y entusiasta para unirse a nuestro equipo de estrategia de conexi√≥n humana de la tribu Human Connection.

Si te apasiona convertir los datos en informaci√≥n procesable y te gusta trabajar directamente con las partes interesadas para influir en las decisiones estrat√©gicas, este puesto es para ti.

Buscamos a alguien que, adem√°s de ser t√©cnicamente competente, pueda traducir informaci√≥n de datos compleja en recomendaciones comerciales claras, comunicarse de manera efectiva con audiencias no t√©cnicas y contribuir a impulsar iniciativas clave dentro de la organizaci√≥n.

Sus Principales Responsabilidades

Como analista de datos , podr√°:


Traduzca los datos en informaci√≥n que informe las decisiones estrat√©gicas y operativas en toda la empresa.
Trabaje en estrecha colaboraci√≥n con las partes interesadas del negocio para comprender sus necesidades, crear conjuntamente enfoques anal√≠ticos y presentar los resultados de una manera que impulse la acci√≥n.
Prepare y entregue presentaciones de alto impacto y narrativas basadas en datos para el liderazgo s√©nior y los equipos multifuncionales.
Cierre la brecha entre los datos y el negocio, garantizando que la informaci√≥n sea comprensible y procesable.
Colabora con otros equipos en un entorno internacional y √°gil, asegurando la alineaci√≥n y la comunicaci√≥n coherente.


¬øQu√© buscamos?

¬øQuieres saber si este trabajo est√° hecho para ti? Estas son algunas de las cualidades que m√°s valoramos para este puesto. Y si el zapato te queda bien... ¬°No dudes en aplicar!

Sabe Sobre

Para nosotros, un analista de datos es alguien que:


Licenciatura en Matem√°ticas, Estad√≠stica, Econom√≠a, Negocios, Ingenier√≠a o similar.
3-4 a√±os de experiencia en an√°lisis de datos, an√°lisis de negocios, consultor√≠a o roles relacionados.
Un s√≥lido conocimiento de SQL y herramientas de visualizaci√≥n de datos (por ejemplo, Power BI, Tableau), python o R es una ventaja, pero no es esencial.
S√≥lida experiencia en narraci√≥n de datos y creaci√≥n de presentaciones comerciales.
Ingl√©s fluido (hablado y escrito)
Comprensi√≥n de la estrategia empresarial y los KPI para conectar la informaci√≥n de los datos con resultados empresariales tangibles


Enlatar


Comunique informaci√≥n de datos complejos de forma clara y persuasiva a las partes interesadas no t√©cnicas.
Identifique de forma proactiva las oportunidades en las que los datos pueden a√±adir valor e influir en las decisiones clave.


Le Encanta


Colaborar en equipos multidisciplinarios, contribuyendo a las conversaciones t√©cnicas y estrat√©gicas.
Presente y defienda sus ideas con confianza y apertura a la retroalimentaci√≥n.


Se Define a S√≠ Mismo Como


Un jugador de equipo con excelentes habilidades interpersonales y de comunicaci√≥n.
Flexible, din√°mico y con ganas de trabajar en entornos cambiantes y de ritmo r√°pido.


¬øQu√© ofrecemos?

El tiempo que pasas en el trabajo, los retos a los que te enfrentas o las lecciones que obtienes son muy importantes, pero... ¬øY tu vida personal? En ING queremos que tu trabajo te llene en todos los sentidos, y por eso cuidamos hasta el m√°s m√≠nimo detalle.

¬°Echa un vistazo a lo que te espera!

S√© flexible, amigo m√≠o.

Nuestro modelo se basa en la flexibilidad y la responsabilidad. Teniendo en cuenta las necesidades de nuestros clientes y de nuestros compa√±eros, decid√≠s juntos qu√© d√≠as trabaj√°is en casa y cu√°les acud√≠s a ING MAD para dar lo mejor de m√≠. Haz lo tuyo.

Tarjeta restaurante.

Para que pensar en qu√© almorzar no ocupe tu tiempo ni tus antojos.

Nuestra casa ser√° tu hogar.

En nuestras oficinas podr√°s encontrar soluciones de movilidad el√©ctrica, m√©dico, peluquer√≠a, gimnasio, El Buen Servicio (para ayudarte con tus recados) ¬°y mucho m√°s!

Seguro de enfermedad.

Para usted y toda su familia (c√≥nyuge/pareja e hijos).

Seguro de vida.

Te ayudamos a proteger lo que m√°s te importa.

Retribuci√≥n flexible.

Adem√°s, disfrutar√°s de nuestro modelo de retribuci√≥n flexible, a trav√©s de una forma m√°s ventajosa fiscalmente, podr√°s acceder a otros servicios como guarder√≠a, tarjeta de transporte, ayudas a la formaci√≥n...

Transporte gratuito de la empresa.

No importa d√≥nde vivas. Disponemos de 6 rutas (Norte, Centro, Sur, A5, A42 y A6) para que llegues c√≥modamente a nuestra oficina de ING en Madrid.

Beneficios bancarios.

Pr√©stamos especiales con condiciones m√°s beneficiosas.

Condiciones especiales de la hipoteca despu√©s de 6 meses trabajando en el banco.

¬°Y podr√°s beneficiarte de nuestro plan de pensiones despu√©s de 1 mes con nosotros!

M√°s vitalidad y m√°s pertenencia

Cuidado 360¬∫ del empleado (f√≠sico, mental, conexi√≥n social y prop√≥sito).

Servicio de fisioterapia in situ.

Cl√≠nicas con atletas profesionales de clase mundial.

Servicio de Gympass.

Redes de empleados: Leones Arco√≠ris (LGBTQI+), Leonas y RI√ëG.

Programa Internacional de Trabajo Remoto.

Con√≥cenos

Somos un equipo de m√°s de 1700 personas que compartimos una idea: aportar nuestro granito de arena para ayudar a nuestros clientes a crear un futuro mejor para ellos mismos, proporcion√°ndoles las herramientas que necesitan para llegar a donde quieren llegar.

Un banco totalmente online donde la tecnolog√≠a, la innovaci√≥n, la sencillez y la transparencia son los ingredientes principales, y el primero en trabajar con metodolog√≠as √°giles.

Y aunque estamos ubicados en Espa√±a, tenemos la suerte de trabajar en un banco internacional con presencia en m√°s de 40 pa√≠ses.

Estamos orgullosos de contar con un equipo diverso y nos comprometemos a seguir desarrollando una cultura de Diversidad, Inclusi√≥n y Pertenencia para fomentar una cultura de colaboraci√≥n e innovaci√≥n que represente a todos los colectivos de la sociedad.

Y aunque nos veamos naranjas por fuera, somos verdes por dentro. Nuestra ambici√≥n en materia de sostenibilidad es potenciar nuestro camino hacia la sostenibilidad. Estamos embarcando en nuestro camino, por nosotros, pero tambi√©n estamos ah√≠ para cuando nuestros clientes decidan embarcarse en este viaje.

Hacer que las cosas sucedan, ayudar a otros a tener √©xito, estar siempre un paso adelante, ese es nuestro ADN. Si te miras al espejo y tu reflejo coincide con nuestra forma de ser y de trabajar... ¬°Te esperamos!

, ING Bank

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that‚Äôs what we‚Äôre doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we‚Äôve still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

About The Position

As a Data Analyst, you'll be part of an exceptional team of over 30 SQL and data visualization specialists. Our Data Analytics department is organized around 11 problem spaces that mirror the structure of the entire company, ensuring that every decision we make at Cabify is data-driven.

In your day-to-day role, you'll work in a multidisciplinary squad with other disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Growth, and Operations. We also follow agile methodologies within each analytics group and foster an environment of knowledge and resource sharing among the department.

If you're passionate about managing large volumes of data, you'll be delighted to know we leverage two different data warehouses, Google BigQuery and Amazon Redshift, to perform intensive analysis thus maximizing operational efficiency.

We take pride in working with one of the largest Tableau Server platforms in Europe, where we share not only powerful analysis and visualizations but also Self Service Data Sources, making data accessible to the entire company.

You Will

Work in technical data projects autonomously to enhance the company's analytics capabilities through functions such as:


Exploit large-scale data warehouses performing efficient SQL.
Define ETL models in our datawarehouse with Airflow.
Document and maintain your code and queries in Gitlab.
Create dashboards and reports using Tableau / PowerBI to communicate results and monitor KPIs regularly.
Execute exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide action recommendations.
Present findings to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Work closely with engineers to define what data is needed for analysis, request creation of new app events, 3rd party integrations, collaborate in the data models design, granularity, and how they relate to existing models.
Help design new features alongside product managers and engineers, measuring their performance and testing their business impact.
Develop Data Sources to use across the organization, thus empowering business by exploring data in a trusted environment.


Our Ideal Candidate Has


Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of working experience as a Data Analyst
Experienced in writing and understanding complex SQL and working with large data sets
Working knowledge of Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, or any other data visualization tool
Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields
Fluency in English and Spanish


Bonus Points


A Master's degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar


What‚Äôs it like to work at Cabify?

We‚Äôre a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team

‚åöHybrid Model (2 work-from-home days per week plus 6 weeks per year)

üí∂Excellent Salary conditions: L2 [30-40K‚Ç¨]

üèùÔ∏èRecharge days

üåçOur office is located in Madrid.

‚åöFlexible work environment & hours.

üôåRegular team events.

üöóCabify staff free rides.

üöÄPersonal development programs based on our career paths.

üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è iFeel: Free access to the iFeel platform, so you can take care of your emotional well-being through therapy sessions.

Cabify is proud of being an equal-opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age, or ability.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Grupo Fertiberia is a major player in the plant nutrition sector in Europe and also produces environmental solutions for industry and other sectors. The company has 14 production centres spread across the Iberian Peninsula and France. Grupo Fertiberia¬¥s vision is to lead the green hydrogen value chain of the future in Europe to decarbonise agriculture and other sectors such as industry and transport, as well as to continue leading the development of sustainable solutions with high added value for crop nutrition. It is also the first company in its sector to commit to achieving zero net emissions by 2035.




The position will belong to Fertiberia Corporate and will be based in Madrid, with the possibility of occasional travel to one of the work centres of the group's companies.




We are looking for a Data Analyst reporting to the Data manager of de company. This person will be responsible for creating analysis, dashboards, and reports to support relevant decision-making by our Business Managers.




Key Responsibilities:




Learning and fully understanding the data landscape in databases.
Working closely with different stakeholders to identify their needs and gathering end user reporting and dashboard requirements.
Using and developing data from different areas.
Report and create different KPI‚Äôs.
Automatization of processes (RPA)
Supporting use of model outputs for decision making and insights.




Position requirements:




Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related field. A Master‚Äôs degree or relevant certification is preferred.
Specific training in: Data Management Tools and Power BI (It is a must); Data pre-processing techniques and data optimization.
Experience: At least 2 years of experience working with a high volume of information and with different data sources. Experience working or ability to work with predefined deadlines.
Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Proficiency in project management software and tools.
Attributes: The candidate must be an analytical, dynamic, innovative, quick learner, autonomous person, with the ability to work in transversal teams and push projects.
English: C1 level
Computer tools: Excel; Power BI; Proficiency in Power Apps, Power Automate and RPA tools knowledge.
Availability for immediate hiring
Willingness to travel occasionally




If you meet the requirements and consider yourself a person with initiative, results and internal customer oriented, this is your opportunity to join a leading group. Do not hesitate to apply! We are looking for you!




We are a company committed to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion, as well as personal and family balance. The selection process for this offer guarantees equal opportunities for all candidates without any distinction based on gender, disability, race, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion


Required Qualifications


2 years experience
Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
Some knowledge and experience working with Python
Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker


About Electronic Arts

We‚Äôre proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.

Key Responsibilities:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies
Use Excels skills to accomplish tasks of more complex nature (vlookups, pivot tables, IF conditions..)
Ensure data accuracy
Improve operations/processes for the team by identifying trends
Implement consumer data acquisition, e-commerce analytics and trigger-based marketing
Implement consumer analytics, consumer segmentation and profiling
Respond to data analysis requests from stakeholders and staff members
Retrieving data, cleaning and preparing data for analysis, performing data analysis, and uploading the information to various sources
Help with Daily, Weekly, Monthly & Annual reporting
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality
Defining the data quality standards in the context of the specific initiatives
Maintain functional expertise in database analytics best practices and the tools that support them
Work with cross-functional teams such as engineering, product management, business intelligence to deploy data quality across critical pipelines and to set up processes to triage data issues
Create and optimise metrics and reporting functions to measure and monitor data quality for our most critical data assets
Effectively and timely communicate data quality insights and drive projects to improve data quality
Research data sources and make any corrections to existing data as needed to ensure accuracy of the information being recorded
Real time data analyst, monitoring and identifying performance drops using analytics tools to ensure timely resolution and maintain optimal product functionality.
Reviewing data control alerts, ensuring that processes operate effectively and efficiently, enabling proactive identification and resolution of data issues



Requirements

What will make you stand out from the crowd:


BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or analytical field.
Excellent judgement, critical-thinking, and decision-making skills
Extremely detailed oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical problem solving skill
Advanced Expertise in MS Excel and Google sheet required
Preferred knowledge/experience with Analytics Platform and SQL
Knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have., ideally with experience in international environments
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have



Benefits

Perks of being one of us:


Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean



Sounds good? Apply now!

We're looking forward to getting to know you :)

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Desde Prosegur buscamos un/a‚ÄØAnalista de Datos. La posici√≥n se ubica en Madrid y contar√°s con modelo h√≠brido de trabajo (compaginando teletrabajo con asistencia a la oficina).

¬øCu√°l ser√° tu misi√≥n?

La misi√≥n de esta posici√≥n es‚ÄØgenerar reportes de alto nivel‚ÄØpara nuestros departamentos internos como finanzas, tecnolog√≠a y transformaci√≥n, proporcionando informaci√≥n clave que facilite la toma de decisiones estrat√©gicas. Enfocado en crear reportes que sean √∫tiles para el comit√© de direcci√≥n en todos los departamentos y pa√≠ses, asegurando una respuesta y soluci√≥n efectiva a sus necesidades.

¬øQu√© funciones vas a realizar?

Nuestro proyecto abarca desde colaborar con el personal operativo de cada departamento para evaluar la calidad de los datos y determinar su origen, hasta trabajar directamente con los directores para generar reportes siguiendo sus directrices.

Las tareas incluyen:


Conocimiento del dato:‚ÄØComprender profundamente los datos disponibles.
An√°lisis de la calidad del dato:‚ÄØEvaluar la precisi√≥n y fiabilidad de los datos.
Mejora de la calidad del dato y estandarizaci√≥n de procesos:‚ÄØImplementar mejoras y estandarizar procesos cuando sea necesario.
Generaci√≥n del reporte final:‚ÄØCrear reportes finales con la colaboraci√≥n de los directores de cada departamento.
Formaci√≥n a los usuarios finales:‚ÄØCapacitar a los usuarios finales en el uso y comprensi√≥n de los reportes generados.


¬øQu√© buscamos de ti?

Principalmente queremos incorporar a personas comprometidas, con inter√©s y pasi√≥n real por el an√°lisis de datos, y con muchas ganas de aprender en un entorno retador como Prosegur. Adem√°s:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (12-Month Contract, $5000/Month)




Location: Fully Remote




Schedule: Full-time, European Time Zone Availability




Contract: 12 months




Compensation: $5000 per month




Job Purpose

We are seeking a Data Analyst to transform data into actionable insights, deepening our understanding of both the Italian market and the broader classified industry. In this role, you will analyze user behavior, assess strategic initiatives, and experiment with new product features. Your contributions will have a direct impact on business growth.




Key Responsibilities

Data-Driven Product Design: Collaborate with product managers and cross-functional teams to inform and influence design decisions through data insights.
Data Analysis: Leverage our data lake and engineering support to generate high-value insights that drive business strategies.
Hypothesis Testing & Experimentation: Design and execute robust experiments, including A/B tests, to validate hypotheses and enhance decision-making.
Automated Reporting & Dashboards: Develop clear, dynamic dashboards to democratize data access across the organization.
Machine Learning Contribution: Analyze data to support and refine machine learning models, making our product smarter and more personalized.




Experience & Qualifications

Strong proficiency in data extraction tools, particularly SQL and Spark, for handling large datasets.
Skilled in key libraries such as pandas, NumPy, and matplotlib, as well as rapid prototyping tools like Streamlit.
Expertise in analytics programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation and statistical analysis.
Experience writing complex SQL queries, working with large datasets, and utilizing Spark for distributed data processing.
Proficiency in data visualization platforms such as Tableau, with the ability to create impactful dashboards for diverse audiences.
Strong foundation in experiment design, hypothesis testing, and statistical analysis.
Ability to align analytical findings with strategic goals, prioritizing insights that drive meaningful business outcomes.
Self-motivated and proactive in managing projects, setting priorities, and meeting deadlines.
Strong knowledge of applied statistical techniques for robust data analysis.
Excellent data visualization and presentation skills for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Advanced English proficiency.




Nice to Have

Hands-on experience with designing, training, and deploying machine learning models.
Familiarity with ML Ops tools such as Kubeflow or MLflow for model tracking and lifecycle management.
Basic knowledge of Git, including version control workflows, branching, and pull requests.

Desde seguros m√©dicos privados hasta descuentos en gimnasios e iniciativas de bienestar: estamos aqu√≠ para ayudarte. Sabemos lo importantes que son tu salud y tu bienestar, as√≠ que haremos todo lo posible para ayudarte.

Si te parece que tenemos algo para ti, veamos si tienes las aptitudes que buscamos

Te incorporar√°s como Data Analyst en el equipo de Online Sales & Marketing para apoyar a identificar y mejorar iniciativas de crecimiento y de eficiencia del negocio, analizando los principales factores que est√°n afectando y/o condicionando nuestro desempe√±o y resultados en ventas y en retenci√≥n de p√≥lizas.

En concreto, trabajar√°s con los diferentes equipos de Prima, con las siguientes responsabilidades:

Conversi√≥n online

  • Analizar los factores que impactan la conversi√≥n del funnel de los usuarios que llegan a nuestra p√°gina web por los diferentes canales, apoy√°ndote en el an√°lisis detallado de datos y en las herramientas de an√°lisis web como Google Analytics y Content Square e interactuando con equipos de Product y de UX para identificar mejoras.
  • Crear y mantener dashboards en Tableau para respaldar las decisiones estrat√©gicas del equipo de Online Sales y dar soporte a los equipos de Product y Product Analytics.
  • Implementar un sistema de intercambio de datos con otros equipos locales y globales de la compa√±√≠a.
  • Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a aumentar la conversi√≥n online y mejorar la experiencia de usuario.
  • Trabajar con nuestros partners externos como Comparadores para mejorar nuestro posicionamiento y darles soporte en desarrollos que mejoren la experiencia de los usuarios y su potencial de conversi√≥n.

Eficiencia operativa

  • Analizar oportunidades para mejorar la eficiencia del equipo de Atenci√≥n al Cliente, dando soporte al Team Leader, a partir de los datos de las interacciones con clientes.
  • Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a mejorar los resultados y la contribuci√≥n de los agentes.
  • Crear dashboards de monitoreo y an√°lisis de desempe√±o con respecto a la fuente, el tipo de interacciones y actividades del cliente para mejorar la eficiencia.

Otras √°reas

  • Trabajar con otros Data Scientists y Data Analysts de la compa√±√≠a para desarrollar y fortalecer la cultura de datos de Prima, buscando y compartiendo mejores pr√°cticas.
  • Dar soporte a la Head of Online Sales & Marketing en iniciativas y proyectos estrat√©gicos, como el lanzamiento de nuevos canales online, o la definici√≥n de modelos de atribuci√≥n.

¬øQu√© buscamos?

Ser√≠as ideal para el equipo si cumples estos requisitos:

  • Al menos 1-2 a√±os de experiencia en an√°lisis de datos.
  • Buena experiencia en la creaci√≥n de datasets utilizando diferentes herramientas para manipulaci√≥n y extracci√≥n de datos (MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL).
  • Buenas habilidades de visi√≥n de negocio.
  • Habilidades anal√≠ticas y experiencia en la creaci√≥n de modelos en Excel o Tableau.
  • Grado en Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas u otros grados STEM relacionados.
  • Nivel de ingl√©s medio-avanzado, imprescindible para comunicarse entre los equipos globales.

Ser√≠a fant√°stico si...

Adem√°s de los requisitos b√°sicos, evaluaremos con atenci√≥n las siguientes caracter√≠sticas:

  • Experiencia usando herramientas de web analytics como Google Analytics y Content Square.
  • Buenas habilidades interpersonales y de negociaci√≥n, resoluci√≥n de problemas, determinaci√≥n.
  • Flexibilidad y actitud adaptativa.
  • Iniciativa y proactividad.
  • Experiencia con otras diferentes herramientas tecnol√≥gicas.

Prima es una comunidad formada por personas con talento y ambici√≥n. Ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades de empleo y estamos orientados hacia la diversidad y la inclusi√≥n en el lugar de trabajo. Prohibimos todo tipo de discriminaci√≥n por motivos de raza, color, sexo, religi√≥n, orientaci√≥n sexual, nacionalidad, discapacidad, informaci√≥n gen√©tica, embarazo u otras caracter√≠sticas personales protegidas, tal y como se definen en la legislaci√≥n nacional.

Si te parece que encajamos bien, √∫nete a nosotros en el fast lane.

Title: Brand Data Analyst Junior
Description:
About Smart Protection

Smart Protection is a leading global brand, product, and content protection company, famed for driving online sales and safeguarding the reputation of businesses of all shapes and sizes.

Our focus is on raising awareness about the risks which exist and emerge throughout digital channels.

We're supporting brand owners, resellers, and content providers around the world, giving them visibility of the digital ecosystem, whilst delivering valuable insights which allow for smarter business decisions.

Our pillars: Protection, Technology, People and Innovation.

Do you want to join us?

The role

You will be part of the Data Analysts team: helping to provide our customers the best experience by analyzing and enhancing the data our technology offers. Your mission will be to audit the service we bring to our customers and guarantee that it is of the utmost quality and exceeds expectations. Guided by your Manager, you will analyze data from multiple sources on the internet (Marketplaces, Social Media, Google...), helping make the Internet a safer place.

What will you do?


Analyze and validate data sets
Maintain standards for data reliability.
Execute service quality improvement activities
Work with other departments in order to improve the customer experience.



What skills will you need?


Meticulous and diligent, sharp attention to detail
Great team player
Customer-centric mindset
Getting-things-done attitude
Fliuent English and Spanish
Technology and digital curiosity



What We Offer


A continuously growing Spanish scale-up within a global playing field
The possibility of making a serious impact on our product
Permanent contract. We really want to add talent to our team.
Work from home, remote friendly
Offices Location: Cuzco



What do we need from you?

Academic background in:


Middle and/or Higher Grade (Vocational Training) as: Microcomputer systems and networks, Cybersecurity, Database Administration or similars.
Bachelor Degree as: Information and Digital Content Management, Information and Documentation, Science, Managegement and Service Engineering or similar.



What‚Äôs it like to work at Smart Protection:


We are committed to equal employment opportunity. If you have a special need that requires accommodation, please let us know
If you want to grow professionally and personally, meet new people, learn from the best professionals and work with clients all over the world, then we are waiting for you!

¬øY t√∫? ¬øTe sientes identificad@ con nuestro prop√≥sito?‚ÄØS√∫mate a nuestro Team of Teams aplicando a esta oferta y comienza tu aventura con nosotros.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Are you passionate about data analysis, continuous improvement, and making an impact on business decisions? Are you looking for a unique opportunity to further your career as a Data Analyst? If this sounds appealing to you, then working at Cefetra might be a perfect fit for you!

Who We Are

Cefetra Ib√©rica is the Spanish subsidiary of the Cefetra Group and is based in Madrid. The Cefetra Group consists of various agricultural and food ingredients trading and supply chain management companies with leading brands in the ingredients business. Together we employ over 700 people in 35 offices in 20 countries around the world. We work closely together to provide the best possible service to our customers. We develop supply chains with suppliers and create value by sourcing and supplying raw materials to the global food and feed industry. Check out our corporate movie here.

The job

As a Data Analyst at Cefetra Iberica, you will design, develop and optimise ETL processes and databases to ensure high data quality and accessibility. You will analyse market, operational and financial data to support decision making and improve efficiency. Using Power BI, you will create insightful dashboards and reports, working with different departments to understand their needs and deliver data-driven solutions. You will also identify opportunities for continuous improvement through data analysis and develop scalable, efficient solutions within the Azure Data Platform.

You are

Most importantly, you have a business -oriented mindset and the capacity to translate business issues into tech solutions. To be successful within Cefetra, it is important to have a 'self-starter' mentality, to be open-minded and curious. You will also be able to identify with the following requirements:


You will have at least 2 years' experience in roles such as Data Analyst, Data Engineer, Business Analyst or similar.
You will have advanced knowledge of SQL and databases. You'll also have experience of ETL processes and data modelling.
You are familiar with business intelligence tools, especially Power BI.
You will have strong process analysis skills and a focus on continuous improvement.
You are fluent in both Spanish and English, both verbally and in writing. You'll need to use both languages on a daily basis.



Our offer

You will contribute to projects that have real impact on the business, using advanced technologies in an Azure Data Platform environment. We are always open for a conversation to discuss your individual needs, but please note we offer the following:


An excellent package of primary & secondary working conditions. Of course, a good base salary, holiday allowance, etc.
An open environment where you'll get responsibility, freedom and all the possibilities to learn new programs, software or tools.
Our colleagues are our most important ingredient. We support your career by investing in your development.



If this sounds like you

Interested in an interview? Please apply below and we will contact you a.s.a.p. Or contact Lola Ojanguren our HR Manager via +34 629 80 89 75 or lojanguren@cefetra.es. She will be happy to tell you more about this opportunity and the recruitment process.

Recruitment, consulting other temp/secondment agency?

We appreciate the interest, but we seek all our candidates directly. We understand that you would like to present your candidates our interesting positions, but this is not how we have structured our recruitment process. This means that all unsolicited profiles offered will be treated as direct applications to our vacancies.

Title: Data Analyst (Online Sales)
Description:
¬øTienes ganas de dar forma al futuro de los seguros?

üèÅ La libertad de explorar las posibilidades

En Prima nos movemos r√°pido, pero nos movemos juntos. Invertimos en tu crecimiento; por eso te daremos acceso a un mercado de ense√±anza y aprendizaje. Y tendr√°s sesiones regulares con tu manager para establecer un plan de crecimiento personal.

üåà Nuestra f√≥rmula ganadora: felices y de alto rendimiento

Desde seguros m√©dicos privados hasta descuentos en gimnasios e iniciativas de bienestar: estamos aqu√≠ para ayudarte. Sabemos lo importantes que son tu salud y tu bienestar, as√≠ que haremos todo lo posible para ayudarte.

En concreto, trabajar√°s con los diferentes equipos de Prima, con las siguientes responsabilidades:

Conversi√≥n online

Crear y mantener dashboards en Tableau para respaldar las decisiones estrat√©gicas del equipo de Online Sales y dar soporte a los equipos de Product y Product Analytics.
Implementar un sistema de intercambio de datos con otros equipos locales y globales de la compa√±√≠a.
Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a aumentar la conversi√≥n online y mejorar la experiencia de usuario.
Trabajar con nuestros partners externos como Comparadores para mejorar nuestro posicionamiento y darles soporte en desarrollos que mejoren la experiencia de los usuarios y su potencial de conversi√≥n.


Eficiencia operativa


Analizar oportunidades para mejorar la eficiencia del equipo de Atenci√≥n al Cliente, dando soporte al Team Leader, a partir de los datos de las interacciones con clientes.
Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a mejorar los resultados y la contribuci√≥n de los agentes.
Crear dashboards de monitoreo y an√°lisis de desempe√±o con respecto a la fuente, el tipo de interacciones y actividades del cliente para mejorar la eficiencia.


Otras √°reas


Trabajar con otros Data Scientists y Data Analysts de la compa√±√≠a para desarrollar y fortalecer la cultura de datos de Prima, buscando y compartiendo mejores pr√°cticas.
Dar soporte a la Head of Online Sales & Marketing en iniciativas y proyectos estrat√©gicos, como el lanzamiento de nuevos canales online, o la definici√≥n de modelos de atribuci√≥n.


¬øQu√© buscamos?

Ser√≠as ideal para el equipo si cumples estos requisitos:


Al menos 1-2 a√±os de experiencia en an√°lisis de datos.
Buena experiencia en la creaci√≥n de datasets utilizando diferentes herramientas para manipulaci√≥n y extracci√≥n de datos (MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL).
Buenas habilidades de visi√≥n de negocio.
Habilidades anal√≠ticas y experiencia en la creaci√≥n de modelos en Excel o Tableau.
Grado en Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas u otros grados STEM relacionados.
Nivel de ingl√©s medio-avanzado, imprescindible para comunicarse entre los equipos globales.


Ser√≠a fant√°stico si...

Adem√°s de los requisitos b√°sicos, evaluaremos con atenci√≥n las siguientes caracter√≠sticas:


Experiencia usando herramientas de web analytics como Google Analytics y Content Square.
Buenas habilidades interpersonales y de negociaci√≥n, resoluci√≥n de problemas, determinaci√≥n.
Flexibilidad y actitud adaptativa.
Iniciativa y proactividad.
Experiencia con otras diferentes herramientas tecnol√≥gicas.


Prima es una comunidad formada por personas con talento y ambici√≥n. Ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades de empleo y estamos orientados hacia la diversidad y la inclusi√≥n en el lugar de trabajo. Prohibimos todo tipo de discriminaci√≥n por motivos de raza, color, sexo, religi√≥n, orientaci√≥n sexual, nacionalidad, discapacidad, informaci√≥n gen√©tica, embarazo u otras caracter√≠sticas personales protegidas, tal y como se definen en la legislaci√≥n nacional.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action


Role Purpose

The Data Analyst will play a key role in advancing forecasting and modelling efforts by managing, analysing, and optimising large datasets across renewable, conventional, and storage assets globally. Working on asset revenue forecasting, power dispatch modelling, or power markets data, the analyst will focus on automating workflows, ensuring data quality, and delivering actionable insights through close collaboration with research, engineering, and product teams. This role contributes directly to improving forecasting accuracy and enhancing the company's global asset performance and revenue strategies.

Responsibilities

Knowledge


Structures poorly defined problems, gathers feedback, and solves them effectively.
Defines hypotheses and appropriate analysis approaches.
Ensures statistical validity of results while avoiding common pitfalls.
Develops deep technical expertise and emerging domain knowledge in forecasting or dispatch modelling.
Provides specialist skills in data analysis, visualisation, and data management.
Fully understands the technical data landscape within the energy domain.
Maintains a growth mindset, continually evolving their skills.


Impact


Performs defined and repeatable tasks with limited guidance.
Independently formulates new analyses and project components.
Carries out independent analysis on specific areas of forecasting or modelling projects.
Delivers high-quality outputs on time, recognised for accuracy and reliability.
Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL or Python for data handling.


Collaboration


Supports data governance and quality assurance activities.
Engages directly with stakeholders, building confidence in data-driven outcomes.
Works closely with peers in Research, Product, Data, Data Engineering, and other business functions.


Innovation


Identifies opportunities for efficiency, optimisation, or new data creation within their focus area.
Uses technical and domain knowledge to create new value and insights.


Specialisms

General


Owns and manages data within their role or team focus.
Leverages specialist toolsets or domain expertise for data analysis and decision-making.


Data Modelling


Applies best practices in data modelling to support use cases.
Translates data requirements into effective data structures.
Collaborates with engineers to enhance data modelling capabilities for large-scale datasets.


Key Expectations

Experience & Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analysis, including handling large, complex datasets.
Advanced SQL skills for querying and managing relational databases.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Sisense, Power BI, Streamlit).


Technical Skills


Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration.
Understanding of statistical methods and data modelling techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms like Snowflake is advantageous.
Knowledge of data governance frameworks and data security protocols.


Soft Skills


Exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving capabilities.
Strong communication skills, able to translate complex insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborative mindset with a commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on energy sector trends.


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Who are we?

We are SET Iberia, the IT, Data and Operations Hub of BNPP Personal Finance, part of BNP Paribas, one of the largest banking groups worldwide. From delivery centers in Spain and Portugal, we provide the best services and solutions to BNPP PF entities around the world to enable sustainable and responsible financial solutions for major retailers, consumer goods companies, mobility brands and dealerships.

Among Other Services, Our Portfolio Is Composed Of


Application Development & Maintenance
IT Risk & Cybersecurity Services.
Data Analytics and AI.
Operations.


Our offices are in Spain (Madrid) and Portugal (Lisbon, Porto). The company brings together over 200+ employees, with techies in various technologies (Java, .Net, Python, AI, Spark, Kafka, Tibco, Apigee) supported by other operational roles (Functional Analyst, Project Manager, Business Analyst, Auto Stock Financing operators). We keep growing!

Our consistent track record of service delivery means customer satisfaction for our partners and opportunities for our employees.

You will find SET Iberia to be an inclusive workplace with an entrepreneurship spirit where you can develop your career and grow personally and professionally.

Would you like to join our international team that delivers end-to-end solutions to businesses of BNP Paribas Personal Finance Group entities around the world?

In a context of increasing the operational excellence of our growing service portfolio we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst.

Mission

We are searching for the best talent to join our worldwide team to manage and process of operational and business data, to manage the architecture and maintenance of the Financial DataMart engine, to manage and lead the developments of the Data Transformation Office team, take of requirements for the different projects of the departament, task automation, transformation and digitalization of processes and elaboration of dashboards and reports.

Main Responsibilities


Financial DataMart Management.
Elaboration of complex scripts to support the business.
Batch process management in Unix. Crontab.
Log management.
Reporting Management.
Technical and functional documentation generation.
Promote cultural change towards a more innovative and dynamic financial area.
Creation of Scorecards.
Process automation.


What We Are Looking For

For us soft skills and endorsing our leadership guidelines (transversality, collective goals, confidence and agility) are equally important as technical skills:


Academic background: Degree / bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience.
You have 4 years of proven working experience in related tasks.
Expertise in the creation of analytical DataMart as well as its management and maintenance.
Knowledge in Oracle database management as well as performance improvements in database generation.
High knowledge of technical tools for database processing and information management: SAS, Spark, Python, Tableau.
You are a team player but as well with capability of working autonomously.
You have a transformation mindset, looking for the excellency but at the same time pragmatic, empathic and able to apply coaching strategies.
You are a problem-solver and decision-making person, who:
Demonstrates advanced analytical skills and aligns and/or validates his decisions with the concerned stakeholders.
Able to mobilize other teams and knock all the needed doors to unblock situations or achieve team goals.


Skills


Communication skills - Oral & Written.
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork.
Proactivity.
Organized, efficient, and able to meet deadlines.
Gives and welcomes feedback. Puts success of the business and team above own interest.
Experience in the Finance sector is a plus.
Fluent level of English is a must. Any other European language is nice to have, specifically French


About Our Culture

We are proud to create, maintain and develop business solutions for BNP Paribas Group entities around the world, while keeping a high level of excellence in our services and providing added value to our customers.

Working in an inclusive and multicultural environment, we encourage everyone to develop their talents and skills, offering various career opportunities and internal mobility programs, within local SET teams or in other entities within the Group.

We value our employees' experience by keeping a well-balanced environment with flexibility regarding the work schedule and care for everyone's personal time.

We embraced a hybrid way of working because we believe social interaction always adds value to our day-to-day activities.

Benefits


Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
Flexible compensation plan.
Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).
31 vacation days.


Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Title: AI (Artificial Intelligence) model analyst
Description:
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.

RISK HUB

RISK is an integrated and independent control function of the BNP Paribas Group. It is the second line of defense on the risk management activities of the Group which are under its direct responsibilities, including credit and counterparty risk, market risk, funding and liquidity risk, interest rate and foreign exchange risks in the banking book, insurance risk, operational risk, and environmental and social risks.

RISK aims at being a partner of the businesses by contributing to their sustainable development, but also a gatekeeper to ensure risks taken remain compatible with the Group‚Äôs Risk Appetite and its strategy.

RISK Iberian Hub Madrid is a transversal platform servicing the RISK Function by covering added-value activities around credit risk, market risk, operational risk and data protection. Offering a wide range of services to RISK teams, from consulting to cyber security going through data analysis, modelling or artificial intelligence.

About The Job

You will join the Global Practice RISK IRC (Independent Review and Control) responsible for:


Independent model validation (RISK IR);
Leading the Group's Model Risk governance (RISK IRCO);
Exercising LoD2 on operational risk generated by the RISK Function processes (RISK ORM RISK);
Participating in validation projects for the BNP Paribas group spread across 9 countries (Europe and North America).


The position is within RISK IR and is located at Mill√©naire 1 in fully renovated premises, eligible for teleworking according to the Group's current agreements.

What about your daily life?

As an AI (Artificial Intelligence) Model Analyst, you will be in charge of the following tasks:


Conducting independent evaluations of the AI models used within BNP Paribas, specifically verifying:
their conceptual robustness,
the validity of their results,
the model performance monitoring system,
the implementation and any other relevant aspect of the modeling affecting the models' use,
Documenting the work and defending the conclusions before a validation committee,
Leveraging your expertise and the independent reviews conducted to keep the Group's AI validation standards up to date,
Collaborating with other RISK IRC streams to benefit from their business expertise,
Working closely with BNPP's data science teams to participate in AI tools experimentation.


And then what?

As part of the Group RISK Function within BNP Paribas‚Äô extensive network of quantitative analysts specializing in risk modelling, you will have a key role to play in understanding and modelling multiple risks to which the Bank is exposed.

In addition, with the focus on compliance with regulatory requirements, you will be involved in future internal or external audit missions where your expertise, communication and analytical skills will be valuable assets. Such an environment guarantees you good prospects for rich and motivating projects.

By its cross-functional nature, this position will enable you to increase your technical expertise, your experience in managing structuring projects for the Group and your versatility and naturally leads to numerous career development opportunities within the RISK Function but also to the Business Lines.

And you? SKILLS

In-depth knowledge of quantitative analysis and AI (time series analysis, data science techniques, statistical inference, segmentation, etc.).

TECHNICAL


Proficiency in programming with a language such as Python or R.
Experience with machine learning libraries such as Scikit-Learn, LightGBM, Tensorflow, or PyTorch.
Experience with version control tools (Git).


TRANSVERSAL


You are adaptable to changes and also comfortable with oral and written communication to convey your messages clearly to various audiences.
You possess strong analytical and synthesis skills, are thorough, curious, proactive, and open to new working methods to enhance our practices and fulfill our missions.
Your command of English is advanced, both written and spoken.


Benefits


Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
Flexible compensation plan.
Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).
32 vacation days.


Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Title: BA - Functional Data Analyst (100% remote, only Spain)
Description:
Role Description

UST is looking for the very Top Talent‚Ä¶and we would be delighted if you were to join our family!

More in detail, UST is a multinational company based in North America, certified as a Top Employer and Great Place to Work company with over 35.000 employees all over the world and a presence in more than 35 countries. We are leaders on digital technology services, and we provide large-scale technologic solutions to big companies.

What are we looking for?

For our specialized team, we are looking for a Business Analyst/Functional Data Analyst, working 100% remote, from Spain.

Work location: 100% remote, within Spain.

Timetable: M-F from 9.00 a.m. to 6.00 p.m.

Tasks

As a Functional Business Analyst for the Data Governance, Quality, and Extraction workstream related to the data governance tool within SCIB, your main tasks within this role will be:


Lead, together with the PO, all workstreams within the data governance workstream.
Identify, analyze, and prioritize user needs and functional requirements.
Manage the internal task backlog, negotiate with the team for execution and prioritization.
Prioritize the backlog with the external tool provider.
Validate the functionalities implemented in the tool and ensure they meet the functional requirements.
Management and review of incidents, tracking them and solutions.
Organize the preparation of deliverables and demos with users.
Attend and manage different meetings and committees.
Design, review, and validation of different requested dashboards, as well as the calculation of different KPIs.
Support and Testing.


Experience & Education


2+ years of experience in Corporate Environment
Background in Data.
Advanced English skills


Skills & Knowledge


Knowledge of data governance tools.
Experience with Agile methodology (JIRA, Confluence), understanding the different meetings and existing task classifications.
Experience working with data exploitation tools, preferably PowerBI.
Knowledge of SQL and other programming languages (Python).
Experience working with Azure Databricks.


Languages


Fluent in Spanish and English.


What can we offer?


23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days!
Numerous benefits (Health Care Plan, teleworking compensation, Life and Accident Insurance).
`Retribuci√≥n Flexible¬¥ Program: (Meals, Kinder Garden, Transport, online English lessons, Health Care Plan‚Ä¶)
Free access to several training platforms
Professional stability and career plans
UST also, compensates referrals from which you could benefit when you refer professionals.
The option to pick between 12 or 14 payments throughout the year.
Real Work Life Balance measures (flexibility, WFH, or remote work policy)
UST Club Platform discounts and gym Access discounts


If you would like to know more, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply and we‚Äôll get in touch to fill you in detail. We are waiting for you!

We have a special commitment to Disability & Inclusion, so we are interested in hiring people with disability certificate.

Title: Spontaneous Application
HTML:
THE PLACE TO BE

Empowered by our motto, "making data matter," Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI &Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation.

With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to help our clients to improve their performance leveraging technological and functional expertise in data and analytics.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, we help our clients on a global level with extensive knowledge, a start-up mindset, and a powerful international network.

We're looking for Talent! Keyrus, a trendsetter in Data & Analytics, Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation, with clients scattered over 25+ countries across 4 continents, is now inviting candidates to do a Spontaneous Application. We are aiming for professionals that possess international work experience.

In the midst of turning the tables in the technological world, our focus is on individuals who demonstrate eminent skills in Data & Analytics.

Working at Keyrus signifies working in a young, vibrant and constantly learning enterprise that values innovation and business alike. At Keyrus, we appreciate those who demonstrate driven motivation, articulate clarity, effective communication, and a seasoned professional background.

What Your Role Will Look Like

  • Applying your expertise in Data & Analytics, to contribute to various projects;
  • Using your multilingual skills, you will be expected to communicate with our international clients and partners effectively;
  • Sharing your International Experience, to enhance our multicultural working environment and drive business forward;
  • Demonstrating Motivation, Clarity, Communication, and Seniority in every task you undertake.

For this specific job we are looking for individuals with:

  • At least 3+ years experience in the Data market;
  • Experience with Data Analytics and/or Data Engineering tools;
  • Proficiency in English and Spanish;
  • Fluency in other languages is a nice to have - Portuguese, French, Dutch, German or Italian;
  • Prior experience on an international work environment;
  • Have a valid work-permit for Spain;

Soft skills

  • A highly motivated and clear approach to problem solving;
  • Strong communication skills;
  • A collaborative mindset.

CAREEER

The sky is the limit! We believe in people and the value they bring to our organization, that is why we are proud to have a company culture focused on people and for the people.

LEARNING AND DEVELOPMENT

In constant improvement! Our employees are the engine that makes Keyrus work every day, and those who make the difference in the projects we develop constantly receive training in the most cutting-edge technologies.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

Good vibes only! We have a diverse, inclusive and pleasant environment. Teamwork, good environment, and company events we organize throughout the year to nurture and continually improve the company-employee relationship.

INNOVATION

We want to change the world! Innovation runs in our DNA, and we want our future co-workers to have that passion, commitment, enthusiasm and cooperative spirit that is part of our essence.

Social Benefits

Our strategy to change and improve our world begins through different social initiatives promoted by our Human Resources department such as flexible hours, family conciliation, and competitive remuneration packages at market level.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:

Desde Inetum, estamos buscando un/a Data Engineer para unirse a proyecto de unjo de nuestros grandes clientes del sector bancario, con modalidad de trabajo h√≠brida en sus en Madrid capital. Title: AI (Artificial Intelligence) model analyst
Description:
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.

RISK HUB

RISK is an integrated and independent control function of the BNP Paribas Group. It is the second line of defense on the risk management activities of the Group which are under its direct responsibilities, including credit and counterparty risk, market risk, funding and liquidity risk, interest rate and foreign exchange risks in the banking book, insurance risk, operational risk, and environmental and social risks.

RISK aims at being a partner of the businesses by contributing to their sustainable development, but also a gatekeeper to ensure risks taken remain compatible with the Group‚Äôs Risk Appetite and its strategy.

RISK Iberian Hub Madrid is a transversal platform servicing the RISK Function by covering added-value activities around credit risk, market risk, operational risk and data protection. Offering a wide range of services to RISK teams, from consulting to cyber security going through data analysis, modelling or artificial intelligence.

About The Job

You will join the Global Practice RISK IRC (Independent Review and Control) responsible for:


Independent model validation (RISK IR);
Leading the Group's Model Risk governance (RISK IRCO);
Exercising LoD2 on operational risk generated by the RISK Function processes (RISK ORM RISK);
Participating in validation projects for the BNP Paribas group spread across 9 countries (Europe and North America).



The position is within RISK IR and is located at Mill√©naire 1 in fully renovated premises, eligible for teleworking according to the Group's current agreements.

What about your daily life?

As an AI (Artificial Intelligence) Model Analyst, you will be in charge of the following tasks:


Conducting independent evaluations of the AI models used within BNP Paribas, specifically verifying:
their conceptual robustness,
the validity of their results,
the model performance monitoring system,
the implementation and any other relevant aspect of the modeling affecting the models' use,
Documenting the work and defending the conclusions before a validation committee,
Leveraging your expertise and the independent reviews conducted to keep the Group's AI validation standards up to date,
Collaborating with other RISK IRC streams to benefit from their business expertise,
Working closely with BNPP's data science teams to participate in AI tools experimentation.



And then what?

As part of the Group RISK Function within BNP Paribas‚Äô extensive network of quantitative analysts specializing in risk modelling, you will have a key role to play in understanding and modelling multiple risks to which the Bank is exposed.

In addition, with the focus on compliance with regulatory requirements, you will be involved in future internal or external audit missions where your expertise, communication and analytical skills will be valuable assets. Such an environment guarantees you good prospects for rich and motivating projects.

By its cross-functional nature, this position will enable you to increase your technical expertise, your experience in managing structuring projects for the Group and your versatility and naturally leads to numerous career development opportunities within the RISK Function but also to the Business Lines.

And you? SKILLS

In-depth knowledge of quantitative analysis and AI (time series analysis, data science techniques, statistical inference, segmentation, etc.).

TECHNICAL


Proficiency in programming with a language such as Python or R.
Experience with machine learning libraries such as Scikit-Learn, LightGBM, Tensorflow, or PyTorch.
Experience with version control tools (Git).



TRANSVERSAL


You are adaptable to changes and also comfortable with oral and written communication to convey your messages clearly to various audiences.
You possess strong analytical and synthesis skills, are thorough, curious, proactive, and open to new working methods to enhance our practices and fulfill our missions.
Your command of English is advanced, both written and spoken.



Benefits


Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
Flexible compensation plan.
Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).
32 vacation days.



Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.
