Title: Logistics Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Intern Global E-Commerce Data Analyst - English Speaker
Description:
About this Position Are you a curious, data driven and energetic individual willing to solve critical challenges with passion and innovation? Are you seeking to be the connection between our internal international teams and agencies? If this sounds like you, keep reading! Successful candidate will be part of our E-commerce Global team that defines, develops, and executes the eCommerce strategy for Henkel Consumer Adhesives.

What You¬¥ll Do


Support Ecom global team in the roll-out of data usage and strategies across countries.
Deliver high quality reports and analysis for our stakeholders (global teams)
Tracks, processes, analyses and verifies data in order to improve accuracy and quality.
Regular trend research and competitive analyses.
Own set of responsibilities for one or several projects.


What makes you a good fit


Degree in controlling, statistics, information science, mathematics or similar.
Excellent knowledge of English
Very good command of MS Office, specifically Excel & analytical skills is required
Hands-on experience with common visualization tools is a plus, such as Power BI, Tableau or others
Goal oriented working-style, reliable in project management
Initiative team player who enjoys working in a challenging and exciting environment
Good interpersonal and communication skills


Some perks of joining Henkel


Flexible work scheme with flexible hours, hybrid and work from anywhere policies
Diverse national and international growth opportunities
Meal Allowance for each worked day
Discounts on company products


At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, disabilities, and generations.

HTML:
About this Position Are you a curious, data driven and energetic individual willing to solve critical challenges with passion and innovation? Are you seeking to be the connection between our internal international teams and agencies? If this sounds like you, keep reading! Successful candidate will be part of our E-commerce Global team that defines, develops, and executes the eCommerce strategy for Henkel Consumer Adhesives.

What You¬¥ll Do

  • Support Ecom global team in the roll-out of data usage and strategies across countries.
  • Deliver high quality reports and analysis for our stakeholders (global teams)
  • Tracks, processes, analyses and verifies data in order to improve accuracy and quality.
  • Regular trend research and competitive analyses.
  • Own set of responsibilities for one or several projects.

What makes you a good fit

  • Degree in controlling, statistics, information science, mathematics or similar.
  • Excellent knowledge of English
  • Very good command of MS Office, specifically Excel & analytical skills is required
  • Hands-on experience with common visualization tools is a plus, such as Power BI, Tableau or others
  • Goal oriented working-style, reliable in project management
  • Initiative team player who enjoys working in a challenging and exciting environment
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills

Some perks of joining Henkel

  • Flexible work scheme with flexible hours, hybrid and work from anywhere policies
  • Diverse national and international growth opportunities
  • Meal Allowance for each worked day
  • Discounts on company products

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, disabilities, and generations.

Title: Data Analyst Intern in GCS
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people‚Äôs varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

The Team

Global Customer Support (GCS) is the global organization responsible for Technical Services in the Diagnostics Division, which ensures end-user success. GCS supports the service organizations of the Roche affiliates and the Lifecycle Teams.

The GCS Project & Portfolio Excellence Organizational Effectiveness team empowers the service & support community through data-driven co-created insights to successfully and sustainably enhance service efficiency while ensuring customer satisfaction.

The Role

The Service Data Analyst Intern will support the Service Analytics team in developing and maintaining data-driven solutions, such as dashboards and reports, to provide actionable insights for the entire Service Organization. This internship provides hands-on experience with data visualization tools, data analysis, and collaboration with cross-functional and international teams. The intern will work closely with experienced analysts, contributing to the development of service analytics while gaining exposure to best practices in data visualization, governance, and stakeholder engagement.

Your Key Responsibilities

Assist in the development of Service Analytics solutions (Tableau Dashboards, Reports‚Ä¶):
Support the creation and maintenance of dashboards and reports to provide insights to stakeholders
Ensure data visualizations are clear, accurate, and aligned with business needs
Collaborate with data engineering teams to ensure data reliability and proper governance
Assist in promoting self-service analytics solutions across the organization
Document processes and provide training materials for data consumers
Perform data analysis and insights generation:
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify trends and patterns
Support senior analysts in preparing reports and presentations for stakeholders
Engage in team collaboration and learning:
Work in a collaborative and supportive team environment, sharing knowledge and learning from senior analysts
Adhere to established best practices in analytics and data visualization
Participate in discussions to improve service analytics processes and efficiency
Seek mentorship and professional development opportunities within the team
Support stakeholder engagement and business partnering:
Assist in gathering and understanding data requirements from stakeholders
Help prepare and present reports to business units such as GCS managers, regional leads, and affiliates
Contribute to projects from conception to completion, ensuring alignment with business objectives

Who You Are:

We are looking for someone self-motivated, really passionate about his or her job, and understands that providing a high-quality service is crucial for the organization. Apply if you are


Studies background from a university and recent graduate -no more than 3 years- in the fields of Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Finance, Engineering, or a related field..
Strong communicator in English at full professional proficiency
Some experience in data analysis, visualization, or related areas (academic projects or internships preferred)
Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Thoughtspot, Power BI, Looker)
Understanding of SQL and data manipulation; familiarity with Python or R is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Good communication skills to interact with stakeholders and present findings clearly
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and demonstrate a willingness to learn
A team player who truly believes that together we can go further
Not afraid to fail and learn
Comfort with uncertainty
We are offering a one-year contract starting ideally from May 2025


Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we‚Äôve become one of the world‚Äôs leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Wallapop is a Barcelona based scale-up driven by the purpose to empower people to embrace a more conscious and human way of consumption. We believe in a world where collaborative economy is mainstream. This is what drives us. üí´

Wallapop operates in Spain, Italy and Portugal, offering a catalogue of several hundreds of millions of products and services. Powered by technical innovation and continuous improvement, we bring together the scale & trust of classifieds with the marketplace's convenience & reach. üå± Our mission is to enable a connected trade ecosystem, making 2nd-hand the norm through smart use of technology.

Backed by top investors such as Accel, Insight Partners & Naver Corp we bring our total valuation to 806 million EUR and are embarking on our international journey with the aim to become the world's best unique goods trading platform.

The Challenge üß©

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for working with large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. You will transform data-driven insights into strategic recommendations for stakeholders at all levels, ranging from product teams to tribe leads and company leadership. Collaborating closely with Product, Marketing, Data, and Tech teams, you will design and execute experiments, conduct quantitative research, and ensure continuous access to high-quality data and insightful visualizations.

What You Will Do üëá


Developing metrics, key performance indicators (KPIs) and performance measurement frameworks.
Identifying growth opportunities through data trends using time-series analysis and predictive modeling.
Extracting quantitative insights from data, and translating them into actionable recommendations to address knowledge gaps and drive business impact.
Creating and managing dashboards, enabling easy data access for the stakeholders.
Maintaining data pipelines to ensure efficient data flow and accessibility, and ensuring data quality.
Designing, executing and interpreting A/B tests to evaluate product features or marketing strategies.
Conducting exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand data characteristics, user segments and market evolution.
Contributing to high-quality documentation for metrics, analyses and data models.
Promoting data literacy and a data-driven mindset within the team and the organization.


What We're Looking For üîé


Proven experience in a Data Analyst role, preferably in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.
Expert-level proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, etc.).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of conveying complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in defining and implementing metrics and data models.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts, methodologies, and their practical applications.
Proactive and collaborative mindset, with a proven ability to work effectively across cross-functional teams.
Passion for data and a strong commitment to data-driven decision-making.


What Would Be A Plus üöÄ


Familiarity with Data Warehousing and ETL processes.
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R.
Proficiency with version control systems, particularly Git.
Basic experience in training and applying Machine Learning models and techniques
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
Domain expertise in marketplaces or classifieds.
Exposure to qualitative research methodologies.


Do note that all our jobs are üìç Barcelona based. We follow a hybrid model where flexibility rules. We commit to a minimum of 6 days per month in the office. Each team self-organizes to decide on cadence and in-person/remote rituals.

Wallapop is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees as we want Wallapop to be a place for everyone.

Additionally to the opportunity to contribute to an agile product set up and work together towards achieving our meaningful mission, we offer the following üç≠ Perks & Benefits:


Competitive phantom shares package for all employees
Generous individual learning budget of 2k per year
Group and individual English, Catalan & Spanish lessons as part of our working day
Private Health Insurance with Alan
Flexible working hours + intensive Fridays
Flexible remuneration to deduct from gross salary (kindergarten/food/transport check)
Gym & Wellness plan, including physiotherapist in the office
Generous referral Program & Charity Donation
Bonus for weddings & newborns
Wallapop Renta (Tax income support)
Monthly plan for free shipping, bumps & home-pick-up on our services
Work anniversary Gifts and Birthday Surprises
Contribution towards your WIFI in your monthly payroll
One-off payment based on compensation package to go towards setting up your home office
Relocation package (monetary support and legal advice) and visa sponsorship, if applicable
26 holidays per year
TOP hardware of your choice (latest Apple or Windows)


What does the hiring process for this position look like? üëÄ**Please, note that all interviews take place remotely over hangouts.**

Intro Call - run by talent acquisition, focus on providing more information about the role and the company as well as going over your experience, motivation, and expectations. This usually takes 45-60 minutes.

Online test - you will be sent a coding test to assess your analytical skills.

Case Study Submission - you will be assigned a task to submit within 5 up to 7 days where you will be able to showcase your expertise / technical skills required for the role.

Expertise Interview - run by the hiring team, focus on the required core skills and the ability to deliver in a given context. This usually takes 60-90 minutes.

Stakeholder Interview - run by relevant stakeholders reflecting the reality of the context of the role, focus on the ability to collaborate & deliver in a cross-functional set-up. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Culture Interview - run by culture interviewers, focus on adherence to Wallapop's purpose and business proposition. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Offer - should you be the right candidate, your offer will be discussed over a call with talent acquisition and will then be confirmed in writing.

Title: Data Analyst, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo‚Äôs high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark‚Ä¶)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers‚Äô performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization‚Ä¶)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams‚Ä¶) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years‚Äô experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.)
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy‚Ä¶)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English

Title: Data Analyst, Tracking & Analytics
Description:
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions? Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics? Are you ready to to make a real impact on how global brands use data?

At s360, we're not just collecting data ‚Äì we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth. Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.

Your Key Responsibilities

You will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients. Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.

More Specifically, Your Responsibilities Will Include


Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analytics
Driving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setup
Planning, project management and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basis
Advising and configuration of e.g. Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)
Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setups
Developing documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setups
Implementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platforms
Debugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issues


About Your Future Team

You will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed. We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritising the social aspects of working together. Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.

Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you‚Äôll contribute to building a collaborative environment. You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.

Your profile

You have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.g. a digital agency or an inhouse role in a digital company. You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.

Furthermore, You


High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerce
Have a working knowledge on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Have experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organisations
Comfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writing
Able to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locations
Are a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasks
Are detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutions
Have a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedback
Appreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured manner


Note: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.

What We Offer

You will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry‚Äôs top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before. You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.

Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterised by:


A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional development
Freedom under responsibility and flexible working hours
Ambitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!
Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employees


Our office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city‚Äôs best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.

We‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Is this the right fit for you? Then don‚Äôt hesitate to apply or reach out to Andrej Plancic, Managing Director, at [email protected].

We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.

About S360

s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.

Title: Data Analyst, EMEA Performance Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a Data Analyst in our Analytics Performance Media team, you will drive advertising strategies thanks to your oversight of business objectives and technical expertise of our products.


Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers‚Äô campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
Business strategy: you will partner with account executives, account strategists, and campaign managers to help drive client strategy and direction
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership.
Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for clients.
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company



Your work environment:


Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



Who You Are:


At least 2 years of experience in data analysis
A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Able to solve data problems using Python, SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
You are skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Experience in online advertising, marketing, or consulting will be a plus.
Fluent in English
Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restrictions.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
In November of 2024, Printful and Printify came together as two equals and merged to form a global on-demand powerhouse. This role will involve working across our two platforms and brands, a unique and special challenge. To learn more about the merger, check out our blog post.

About The Role

Join us as a Data Quality Analyst, where your meticulous attention to finance data ensures the availability, completeness, and accuracy of essential information. Your primary focus will be on establishing efficient data retrieval processes and ensuring the highest quality of source data. You will be responsible for gathering all relevant financial data, ensuring its accuracy and prompt availability. A key part of your role will be developing and maintaining a robust data quality monitoring system, and conducting business tests to identify and resolve any issues.

Your Daily Tasks will Entail:


Maintain the accuracy of finance data in the data warehouse by developing and maintaining a robust data quality monitoring system, driving the resolution of identified errors
Collaborate with data engineers and business stakeholders to improve data pipelines
Develop source data tables for finance reporting needs and design scalable data models that facilitate accurate and insightful decision-making
Drive company-wide data accessibility by advocating for self-service data usage and utilizing BI tools such as Looker to empower teams with actionable insights
Keep processes organized and well-documented, contributing to process improvements and ensuring efficiency, particularly during month-end closing activities
Foster cross-functional collaboration by ensuring effective communication and alignment between finance and data teams, supporting seamless integration and cooperation



Your Qualifications:


At least 3 years of experience as a Business Intelligence Developer/Data Analyst
At least 2 years of experience building and enhancing Looker applications and administration
Well-versed in Python and SQL coding
Skills in data modeling and business logic processes
Experience with DWH design
Analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Able to work in a highly collaborative environment
Proactive attitude and ability to work independently, taking ownership of projects and delivering high-quality results within deadlines
Able to demonstrate knowledge of dimensional modeling, and data visualization techniques



What we Offer:


All the resources and tools to perform your tasks (choose between Mac or Windows)
An opportunity to work remotely or in a modern and welcoming office in Rƒ´ga
Flexible working hours (start your day as late as 11 a.m.)
Health insurance, including a mental wellness program
Employee discounts for 300+ premium products
Room for professional growth (conferences, workshops, mentoring, guest lectures)
Exciting team-building events and parties you‚Äôll never forget!



We are an equal opportunity workplace. We‚Äôre committed to diversity and inclusion and make our hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and work experience.

Interested, but don‚Äôt think this is the right fit for you? Feel free to share it with friends and check out other open positions at our career's site. We‚Äôre always looking for creative and driven minds to join our ever-growing team.

Title: Logistics Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Intern Global E-Commerce Data Analyst - English Speaker
Description:
About this Position Are you a curious, data driven and energetic individual willing to solve critical challenges with passion and innovation? Are you seeking to be the connection between our internal international teams and agencies? If this sounds like you, keep reading! Successful candidate will be part of our E-commerce Global team that defines, develops, and executes the eCommerce strategy for Henkel Consumer Adhesives.

What You¬¥ll Do


Support Ecom global team in the roll-out of data usage and strategies across countries.
Deliver high quality reports and analysis for our stakeholders (global teams)
Tracks, processes, analyses and verifies data in order to improve accuracy and quality.
Regular trend research and competitive analyses.
Own set of responsibilities for one or several projects.


What makes you a good fit


Degree in controlling, statistics, information science, mathematics or similar.
Excellent knowledge of English
Very good command of MS Office, specifically Excel & analytical skills is required
Hands-on experience with common visualization tools is a plus, such as Power BI, Tableau or others
Goal oriented working-style, reliable in project management
Initiative team player who enjoys working in a challenging and exciting environment
Good interpersonal and communication skills


Some perks of joining Henkel


Flexible work scheme with flexible hours, hybrid and work from anywhere policies
Diverse national and international growth opportunities
Meal Allowance for each worked day
Discounts on company products


At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, disabilities, and generations.

Title: BI Data Analyst - Hybrid
Description:
BI Data Analyst - (Hybrid)

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking an experienced BI Data Analyst to join our team in Barcelona. Our Business Intelligence team is the centre of excellence for providing insights and learning from the Data. Our goal is to help different teams across the organization to succeed in their mission by providing insights generation and data analysis support in a healthy data-informed environment. If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

21 million customers ‚Äì 44 markets ‚Äì 5 brands ‚Äì 6.5M members in Prime

More than 100 million searches per day - Up to 1.8 billion daily AI predictions

Over 1,600 employees ‚Äì More than 60 different nationalities from all continents

99% permanent contracts - 36 average age

We're the world‚Äôs leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. We are a tech company revolutionizing the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Data Analyst in the BI team, you will be in charge of:


Analyse performance and identify behaviours in different data sets; Translate complex and potentially ambiguous information into a clear structure and actionable deliverables.
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality;
Build and maintain dashboards and/or reports to share performance information with senior management and C-level stakeholders;
Identify and analyze relevant customer data to drive business goals and validate hypothesis & designs; turn data into actionable insights;
Lead data-driven initiatives to improve company decision making and business knowledge
Working with multi-disciplinary teams ‚Äì Qualitative Researchers, Designers, Product Owners, Developers, and Pricing Managers ‚Äì to blend different statistical and data analytics techniques to generate a holistic understanding of the users and markets.



What you need to succeed:

Job Requirements

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:


Degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or other quantitative fields);
Minimum 3 years of experience as an analyst in a digital and eCommerce environment.
Strong knowledge of tools and programming languages such as BigQuery/SQL, Python, R;
Experience with cloud platforms and scalable solutions will be a plus.
Self-starter with good time management skills; able to manage multiple tasks and prioritize quickly the most relevant ones;
Ability to multitask; desire to work in a challenging, fast-paced, high-performance environment;
Written and oral communication skills (in English).



What‚Äôs in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here's what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! üìö Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! üöÄ Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíô At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO! If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
  • Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Title: Data Analyst Intern in GCS
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people‚Äôs varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

The Team

Global Customer Support (GCS) is the global organization responsible for Technical Services in the Diagnostics Division, which ensures end-user success. GCS supports the service organizations of the Roche affiliates and the Lifecycle Teams.

The GCS Project & Portfolio Excellence Organizational Effectiveness team empowers the service & support community through data-driven co-created insights to successfully and sustainably enhance service efficiency while ensuring customer satisfaction.

The Role

The Service Data Analyst Intern will support the Service Analytics team in developing and maintaining data-driven solutions, such as dashboards and reports, to provide actionable insights for the entire Service Organization. This internship provides hands-on experience with data visualization tools, data analysis, and collaboration with cross-functional and international teams. The intern will work closely with experienced analysts, contributing to the development of service analytics while gaining exposure to best practices in data visualization, governance, and stakeholder engagement.

Your Key Responsibilities

Assist in the development of Service Analytics solutions (Tableau Dashboards, Reports‚Ä¶):
Support the creation and maintenance of dashboards and reports to provide insights to stakeholders
Ensure data visualizations are clear, accurate, and aligned with business needs
Collaborate with data engineering teams to ensure data reliability and proper governance
Assist in promoting self-service analytics solutions across the organization
Document processes and provide training materials for data consumers
Perform data analysis and insights generation:
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify trends and patterns
Support senior analysts in preparing reports and presentations for stakeholders
Engage in team collaboration and learning:
Work in a collaborative and supportive team environment, sharing knowledge and learning from senior analysts
Adhere to established best practices in analytics and data visualization
Participate in discussions to improve service analytics processes and efficiency
Seek mentorship and professional development opportunities within the team
Support stakeholder engagement and business partnering:
Assist in gathering and understanding data requirements from stakeholders
Help prepare and present reports to business units such as GCS managers, regional leads, and affiliates
Contribute to projects from conception to completion, ensuring alignment with business objectives

Who You Are:

We are looking for someone self-motivated, really passionate about his or her job, and understands that providing a high-quality service is crucial for the organization. Apply if you are


Studies background from a university and recent graduate -no more than 3 years- in the fields of Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Finance, Engineering, or a related field..
Strong communicator in English at full professional proficiency
Some experience in data analysis, visualization, or related areas (academic projects or internships preferred)
Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Thoughtspot, Power BI, Looker)
Understanding of SQL and data manipulation; familiarity with Python or R is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Good communication skills to interact with stakeholders and present findings clearly
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and demonstrate a willingness to learn
A team player who truly believes that together we can go further
Not afraid to fail and learn
Comfort with uncertainty
We are offering a one-year contract starting ideally from May 2025


Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we‚Äôve become one of the world‚Äôs leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Wallapop is a Barcelona based scale-up driven by the purpose to empower people to embrace a more conscious and human way of consumption. We believe in a world where collaborative economy is mainstream. This is what drives us. üí´

Wallapop operates in Spain, Italy and Portugal, offering a catalogue of several hundreds of millions of products and services. Powered by technical innovation and continuous improvement, we bring together the scale & trust of classifieds with the marketplace's convenience & reach. üå± Our mission is to enable a connected trade ecosystem, making 2nd-hand the norm through smart use of technology.

Backed by top investors such as Accel, Insight Partners & Naver Corp we bring our total valuation to 806 million EUR and are embarking on our international journey with the aim to become the world's best unique goods trading platform.

The Challenge üß©

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for working with large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. You will transform data-driven insights into strategic recommendations for stakeholders at all levels, ranging from product teams to tribe leads and company leadership. Collaborating closely with Product, Marketing, Data, and Tech teams, you will design and execute experiments, conduct quantitative research, and ensure continuous access to high-quality data and insightful visualizations.

What You Will Do üëá


Developing metrics, key performance indicators (KPIs) and performance measurement frameworks.
Identifying growth opportunities through data trends using time-series analysis and predictive modeling.
Extracting quantitative insights from data, and translating them into actionable recommendations to address knowledge gaps and drive business impact.
Creating and managing dashboards, enabling easy data access for the stakeholders.
Maintaining data pipelines to ensure efficient data flow and accessibility, and ensuring data quality.
Designing, executing and interpreting A/B tests to evaluate product features or marketing strategies.
Conducting exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand data characteristics, user segments and market evolution.
Contributing to high-quality documentation for metrics, analyses and data models.
Promoting data literacy and a data-driven mindset within the team and the organization.


What We're Looking For üîé


Proven experience in a Data Analyst role, preferably in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.
Expert-level proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, etc.).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of conveying complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in defining and implementing metrics and data models.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts, methodologies, and their practical applications.
Proactive and collaborative mindset, with a proven ability to work effectively across cross-functional teams.
Passion for data and a strong commitment to data-driven decision-making.


What Would Be A Plus üöÄ


Familiarity with Data Warehousing and ETL processes.
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R.
Proficiency with version control systems, particularly Git.
Basic experience in training and applying Machine Learning models and techniques
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
Domain expertise in marketplaces or classifieds.
Exposure to qualitative research methodologies.


Do note that all our jobs are üìç Barcelona based. We follow a hybrid model where flexibility rules. We commit to a minimum of 6 days per month in the office. Each team self-organizes to decide on cadence and in-person/remote rituals.

Wallapop is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees as we want Wallapop to be a place for everyone.

Additionally to the opportunity to contribute to an agile product set up and work together towards achieving our meaningful mission, we offer the following üç≠ Perks & Benefits:


Competitive phantom shares package for all employees
Generous individual learning budget of 2k per year
Group and individual English, Catalan & Spanish lessons as part of our working day
Private Health Insurance with Alan
Flexible working hours + intensive Fridays
Flexible remuneration to deduct from gross salary (kindergarten/food/transport check)
Gym & Wellness plan, including physiotherapist in the office
Generous referral Program & Charity Donation
Bonus for weddings & newborns
Wallapop Renta (Tax income support)
Monthly plan for free shipping, bumps & home-pick-up on our services
Work anniversary Gifts and Birthday Surprises
Contribution towards your WIFI in your monthly payroll
One-off payment based on compensation package to go towards setting up your home office
Relocation package (monetary support and legal advice) and visa sponsorship, if applicable
26 holidays per year
TOP hardware of your choice (latest Apple or Windows)


What does the hiring process for this position look like? üëÄ**Please, note that all interviews take place remotely over hangouts.**

Intro Call - run by talent acquisition, focus on providing more information about the role and the company as well as going over your experience, motivation, and expectations. This usually takes 45-60 minutes.

Online test - you will be sent a coding test to assess your analytical skills.

Case Study Submission - you will be assigned a task to submit within 5 up to 7 days where you will be able to showcase your expertise / technical skills required for the role.

Expertise Interview - run by the hiring team, focus on the required core skills and the ability to deliver in a given context. This usually takes 60-90 minutes.

Stakeholder Interview - run by relevant stakeholders reflecting the reality of the context of the role, focus on the ability to collaborate & deliver in a cross-functional set-up. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Culture Interview - run by culture interviewers, focus on adherence to Wallapop's purpose and business proposition. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Offer - should you be the right candidate, your offer will be discussed over a call with talent acquisition and will then be confirmed in writing.

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for working with large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. You will transform data-driven insights into strategic recommendations for stakeholders at all levels, ranging from product teams to tribe leads and company leadership. Collaborating closely with Product, Marketing, Data, and Tech teams, you will design and execute experiments, conduct quantitative research, and ensure continuous access to high-quality data and insightful visualizations.

What You Will Do üëá

  • Developing metrics, key performance indicators (KPIs) and performance measurement frameworks.
  • Identifying growth opportunities through data trends using time-series analysis and predictive modeling.
  • Extracting quantitative insights from data, and translating them into actionable recommendations to address knowledge gaps and drive business impact.
  • Creating and managing dashboards, enabling easy data access for the stakeholders.
  • Maintaining data pipelines to ensure efficient data flow and accessibility, and ensuring data quality.
  • Designing, executing and interpreting A/B tests to evaluate product features or marketing strategies.
  • Conducting exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand data characteristics, user segments and market evolution.
  • Contributing to high-quality documentation for metrics, analyses and data models.
  • Promoting data literacy and a data-driven mindset within the team and the organization.

What We're Looking For üîé

  • Proven experience in a Data Analyst role, preferably in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.
  • Expert-level proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, etc.).
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of conveying complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Experience in defining and implementing metrics and data models.
  • Solid understanding of statistical concepts, methodologies, and their practical applications.
  • Proactive and collaborative mindset, with a proven ability to work effectively across cross-functional teams.
  • Passion for data and a strong commitment to data-driven decision-making.

What Would Be A Plus üöÄ

  • Familiarity with Data Warehousing and ETL processes.
  • Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R.
  • Proficiency with version control systems, particularly Git.
  • Basic experience in training and applying Machine Learning models and techniques
  • Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
  • Domain expertise in marketplaces or classifieds.
  • Exposure to qualitative research methodologies.

Do note that all our jobs are üìç Barcelona based. We follow a hybrid model where flexibility rules. We commit to a minimum of 6 days per month in the office. Each team self-organizes to decide on cadence and in-person/remote rituals.

Wallapop is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees as we want Wallapop to be a place for everyone.

Additionally to the opportunity to contribute to an agile product set up and work together towards achieving our meaningful mission, we offer the following üç≠ Perks & Benefits:

  • Competitive phantom shares package for all employees
  • Generous individual learning budget of 2k per year
  • Group and individual English, Catalan & Spanish lessons as part of our working day
  • Private Health Insurance with Alan
  • Flexible working hours + intensive Fridays
  • Flexible remuneration to deduct from gross salary (kindergarten/food/transport check)
  • Gym & Wellness plan, including physiotherapist in the office
  • Generous referral Program & Charity Donation
  • Bonus for weddings & newborns
  • Wallapop Renta (Tax income support)
  • Monthly plan for free shipping, bumps & home-pick-up on our services
  • Work anniversary Gifts and Birthday Surprises
  • Contribution towards your WIFI in your monthly payroll
  • One-off payment based on compensation package to go towards setting up your home office
  • Relocation package (monetary support and legal advice) and visa sponsorship, if applicable
  • 26 holidays per year
  • TOP hardware of your choice (latest Apple or Windows)

What does the hiring process for this position look like? üëÄ**Please, note that all interviews take place remotely over hangouts.**

Intro Call - run by talent acquisition, focus on providing more information about the role and the company as well as going over your experience, motivation, and expectations. This usually takes 45-60 minutes.

Online test - you will be sent a coding test to assess your analytical skills.

Case Study Submission - you will be assigned a task to submit within 5 up to 7 days where you will be able to showcase your expertise / technical skills required for the role.

Expertise Interview - run by the hiring team, focus on the required core skills and the ability to deliver in a given context. This usually takes 60-90 minutes.

Stakeholder Interview - run by relevant stakeholders reflecting the reality of the context of the role, focus on the ability to collaborate & deliver in a cross-functional set-up. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Culture Interview - run by culture interviewers, focus on adherence to Wallapop's purpose and business proposition. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Offer - should you be the right candidate, your offer will be discussed over a call with talent acquisition and will then be confirmed in writing.

Title: Market Data Analyst & CRM Manager
Description:
üöÄ Ready to Shape the Future with Us? We‚Äôre Looking for a Market Data Analyst & CRM Manager!

Do you live and breathe data?

Do you love diving into numbers to uncover insights that can change the game?

Are you ready to be part of something exciting and innovative?

If you said "yes," we want to hear from you!

About Us

We‚Äôre a company that‚Äôs always looking ahead, and right now, we‚Äôre building something big ‚Äî a brand new Business Intelligence (BI) department from scratch. üåü It‚Äôs a challenging and creative opportunity to drive change in our industry, and we need someone like you to join our team.

As a Market Data Analyst & CRM Manager, you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in shaping the direction of our business. You‚Äôll help us make smarter decisions, optimize our CRM, and dive deep into data to fuel our strategy and growth. This is not just a job, it's a chance to innovate and make a real impact!

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

üîß Own the CRM: Be the go-to expert for our CRM system in the commercial area. You‚Äôll keep it running smoothly, develop it, and train our sales team to leverage it for smarter decision-making.

üìà Track & Analyze: Work with the commercial team to track performance against KPIs and ensure we‚Äôre on the right path.

üìä Provide Insights: Collect, analyze, and present key market data that helps our leaders make informed decisions.

üöÄ Innovate: Develop custom projects based on the commercial team‚Äôs needs. Whether it‚Äôs client acquisition, project management, or improving current processes, you‚Äôll have a chance to shape the future.

üí° Collaborate: Work closely with different teams across the company, bringing your insights to life and helping everyone stay aligned.

What We‚Äôre Looking For

‚úÖ A passion for data and a keen eye for details.

‚úÖ Experience in CRM management and market data analysis.

‚úÖ A problem-solver who loves challenges and doesn‚Äôt shy away from taking ownership.

‚úÖ A team player who can collaborate, share insights, and communicate effectively across departments.

‚úÖ Strong skills in BI tools (we love Power BI! üíª)

‚úÖ An educational background in Business Administration, Statistics, Math, or similar fields. A Master‚Äôs in BI or Data Analytics is a big plus!

‚úÖ Fluent in English ‚Äì you‚Äôll be working directly with the team in English on a daily basis.

What We Offer You

üí∏ An attractive salary and benefits package.

üìÖ Flexible work schedule (hello, Fridays with a 6-hour day!).

üè† Work from home up to 6 days a month.

üéâ VIP discounts and perks, plus discounts on paint products (yep, we‚Äôve got you covered!).

üíº A collaborative, dynamic, and supportive work environment.

If you‚Äôre excited to dive into data, make a real impact, and help us build something extraordinary, then this is the role for you!

Come join us on this amazing journey and let‚Äôs build a future we can all be proud of!

If you want to know more about us ü§ó don't hesitate and check out our LinkedIn page.

https://www.linkedin.com/company/cromology-espa%C3%B1a/

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion are at the core of who we are, and we are committed to creating a welcoming environment for all.

Title: Automation Data Analyst I (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-2 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Solid proficiency in programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Excellent SQL skills
Excellent Excel/Google Sheet skills
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

HTML:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY

  • Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
  • Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
  • Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
  • Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.
  • Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
  • Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
  • Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.

What You Will Bring To The Ride

  • 1-2 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
  • Solid proficiency in programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
  • Excellent SQL skills
  • Excellent Excel/Google Sheet skills
  • Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Great spoken and written English.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable

  • üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
  • üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Lead Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Main challenge

Together with a talented team of data analysts and scientists, you will extract actionable insights from our vast marketing and in-game data, helping drive game growth and enhance marketing profitability and efficiency.

What It Means On a Daily Basis


Develop an in-depth understanding of our data warehouse, focusing on Marketing and game tracking data.
Become an expert in our marketing data dimensions and measurement definitions.
Conduct comprehensive 360-degree analyses to provide timely, data-driven answers to key stakeholder questions.
Translate analytical findings into strategic recommendations for Marketing and game teams.
Leverage statistical analysis to optimize Marketing testing methodologies and outcomes.
Manage and level up a small team of marketing analysts


Who You Will Be Working With

Joining our Global Data Science and Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with our Marketing vertical teams, including User Acquisition (UA), Influencer Marketing, and Studio Marketing Activation.

WHO YOU ARE


A collaborative team player with a positive attitude and excellent organizational skills. Good verbal, written, and interpersonal skills needed
You pay strong attention to data quality and you have a passion for deep quantitative analysis
A genuine passion for gaming and the gaming industry


What You Need To Succeed


5+ years of professional experience, 2+ years as a team lead
SQL (Big Query) expertise, crafting complex & efficient queries
Python and R expertise is required
Proven ability in creating clear and impactful data visualizations and dashboards using Data Viz tool(s)
Familiarity with key marketing metrics (CPI, RoAS, creative optimization) and channels
Solid understanding of statistical analysis and its applications in marketing and UA.
Fluent in English, good presenter and communicator.


Please attach a resume in English to your application.

  • Fluent in English, good presenter and communicator.

Please attach a resume in English to your application.
