Title: Business Intelligence Europe Trainee
Description:
UPL Limited is a global provider of sustainable agriculture products and solutions, with annual revenue exceeding $6bn. We are a purpose-led company. Through OpenAg¬Æ, UPL is focused on accelerating progress for the food system. We are building a network that is reimagining sustainability, redefining the way an entire industry thinks and works ‚Äì open to fresh ideas, innovation, and new answers as we strive towards our mission to make every single food product more sustainable. As one of the largest agriculture solutions companies worldwide, our robust portfolio consists of biologicals and traditional crop protection solutions with more than 14,000 registrations. We are present in more than 130 countries, represented by more than 10,000 colleagues globally.




That‚Äôs your opportunity! At UPL we are looking for a Business Intelligence Europe Trainee to join the Europe Marketing Department! The person will be based in Madrid or Barcelona and will collaborate with our Business Intelligence Europe team for a period of 6 to 12 months! Join us and make an impact!




Job Description:

Portfolio and Project data Management support.
Business data, collection and processing.
Support in analytics and data reporting.
Data warehouse and database maintenance.
Market data analysis.
Cross-functional data support and collaboration.




Qualifications and Skills:

Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in business analytics, data science, statistics, marketing, finance, business administration or equivalent combination of education.
Fluency in English (spoken and written).
Additional knowledge of other languages is a plus.
Good database management skills (Excel, Pivot Tables, I, others as plus, eg: Qlik, Power BI)
Ability to manage and interpret data, identify trend and provide insights.
Good communication skills.
Ability to work and collaborate in a multidisciplinary team.
Ability to be autonomous and fast learner.
Highly organized and able to work on several projects simultaneously.




Technical skills:

Excel skills (advanced functions, pivot tables and query handling), data visualization, dashboard creation and reporting (Qlik Sense, Power BI, Tableau) and comfortable working with large datasets and ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Experience in working with cloud-based data storage platforms, familiarity with data extraction, transformation and loading (ETL) processes and basic knowledge of SQL is a plus.




Notice to Recruiters and Staffing Agencies:

UPL and its affiliates and subsidiaries ("UPL") have an internal recruiting department. UPL may supplement that internal capability from time to time with assistance from temporary staffing agencies, placement services, and professional recruiters ("Agency"). Agencies should only contact UPL‚Äôs Human resources department (hereafter referred to as HR department) for staffing requirements at UPL which would present all candidates internally. Agency must obtain written approval from UPL's HR department before submitting resumes, and then only in conjunction with a valid fully executed contract for service and in response to a specific job opening will UPL pay the agreed upon service fees. UPL will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have such agreement in place.




Diversity&Inclusion at UPL:

UPL is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Open Digital Services is the software development company of Santander Group powering the next generation of banks by creating innovative banking products and implementing them in collaboration with Santander Group Affiliates.

Santander Group is one of the world's largest financial institutions and the Eurozone's leader, we're committed to being the best Digital Bank with Branches in the industry.

Our mission at ODS is to design and support an advanced digital and omnichannel platform, ensuring the best customer experience using cutting-edge technology. Openbank, our flagship partner, is where we develop our most advanced concepts first. Be part of our Best-in-Class team and help us create unique value for our customers!

Join us to tackle exciting tech challenges in an agile environment, benefiting from learning, growth, and local and international career opportunities in a modern, diverse setting.




Mission and responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a role in interpreting and analyzing complex data from various business areas. Your primary focus will be on leveraging advanced analytics techniques to uncover insights, identify trends, and drive data-driven decision-making processes.

The main tasks of this position will be the following:

Collect and interpret data from various sources within the AWS Datalake to generate actionable insights.
Analyze results from diverse commercial actions to identify opportunities for business optimization, leveraging advanced analytics techniques.
Develop end-to-end Machine Learning models to optimize business processes.
Communicate findings effectively through reports and data visualization tools.
Identify patterns and trends in datasets, automate routine tasks, and focus efforts on analyzing anomalous or unexpected patterns.
Design and implement new data collection and analysis processes tailored to business verticals such as Wealth and new geographic markets.
Locate and propose opportunities for process enhancements to improve efficiency and outcomes.
Develop and implement scripts or dashboards to streamline recurring tasks and support scalability.
Generate comprehensive documentation of all processes to ensure knowledge transfer, easy understanding, and secure backup.




To be successful in the role you must have:

+3 years of experience working on a team with experience understanding risk/ portfolio construction and analytics; predictive modelling, and Machine Learning applications.
University or Master‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science / Telecom. / Maths / Physics / Industrial engineer.
Strong programming skills for data analytics and Machine Learning/AI.
Strong Python and PySpark skills ‚Äì knowledge of data management.
Experience with SQL for managing and accessing data.
Familiarity with software development tools such as GitHub.
Excellent communication/ presentation skills, confidence, and ability to influence, coach, educate fundamental PMs. Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Interest in learning from other Data Science experts, using feedback to improve analysis and understanding of strategies.
Attention to detail and passion/ grit for getting things done, digging into problems, and helping develop solutions.
Sense of ownership and entrepreneurialism to grow business.
Strong knowledge and/or experience on project management, PMI Certification will be a plus.
Knowledge of the Agile framework.




What do we offer?

Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.




Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:

Extraer y analizar datos directamente desde fuentes como SQL y Google Analytics con un enfoque t√©cnico y proactivo.

En Wetaca queremos convertirnos en un movimiento de gente que quiere vivir bien en todos los sentidos.


El ritmo de vida actual lleva a muchas personas a tener que elegir entre comer comer rico y comer sano o a priorizar la rapidez, dejando en un segundo plano la calidad y sabor de lo que comen en su d√≠a a d√≠a. Por eso en Wetaca cocinamos para que comer genial est√© al alcance de todos y la comida sea un sin√≥nimo de disfrute, bienestar y tranquilidad.


Somos la suscripci√≥n semanal de comida a domicilio l√≠der del mercado y repartimos en toda la pen√≠nsula. Cocinamos comida casera y real (con ingredientes naturales, sin aditivos ni conservantes y todo desde cero) para ofrecer men√∫s variados y para todos los gustos, para que nuestros clientes coman bien y ganen tiempo para s√≠ mismos. Nuestro objetivo es que conf√≠en en nosotros y nos deleguen el preparar su comida, que sepan que We TAke CAre, que nosotros nos encargamos de todo.


Si eres una persona con hambre y buscas un sitio en el que crecer, tenemos una vacante para ti.


Buscamos un Product Data Analyst con 2-3 a√±os de experiencia, capaz de entender las necesidades del producto digital y transformarlas en datos e insights accionables para mejorar la experiencia de nuestros usuarios. Formar√° parte del equipo de producto digital, desempe√±ando un rol clave en el an√°lisis del comportamiento de los usuarios y la evaluaci√≥n del impacto de nuevas funcionalidades, ayud√°ndonos a descubrir oportunidades de negocio.


¬øQu√© har√°s?

Potencia la toma de decisiones en un equipo de producto digital.

  • Autonom√≠a para plantear hip√≥tesis e identificar qu√© informaci√≥n es clave para responder preguntas de negocio y producto.
  • Extraer y analizar datos directamente desde fuentes como SQL y Google Analytics con un enfoque t√©cnico y proactivo.
  • Conocimientos en Python/R para procesamiento y an√°lisis avanzado de datos.
  • Capacidad para procesar y estructurar consultas.
  • Detectar tendencias en datos hist√≥ricos y proyectar futuros comportamientos para guiar la toma de decisiones.
  • Medir y validar hip√≥tesis de experimentos y pruebas A/B.
  • Preparar informes para responder a preguntas clave utilizando herramientas como Looker, Power BI o similares.


En definitiva, colaborar de cerca con Producto, Dise√±o y IT para identificar oportunidades de crecimiento y mejorar la experiencia del usuario con datos.


¬øQui√©n eres?

  • 2-3 a√±os de experiencia en un rol anal√≠tico, aportando insights accionables.
  • Formaci√≥n o experiencia en disciplinas cuantitativas (Econom√≠a, Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas, Ingenier√≠a, etc.).
  • S√≥lidos conocimientos de lenguajes de programaci√≥n y herramientas de an√°lisis y procesamiento de datos: SQL, Python, R.
  • Base en estad√≠stica y experimentaci√≥n (A/B testing, cohort analysis, modelos de segmentaci√≥n).
  • Habilidad para visualizar datos y comunicar insights de forma clara y accionable.
  • Mentalidad anal√≠tica y colaborativa, con ganas de trabajar codo a codo con Producto, Dise√±o y Tech.


¬øC√≥mo estar√°s?

  • Trabajar√°s en un equipo donde los datos son clave para la estrategia, no un complemento.
  • Tendr√°s autonom√≠a para explorar y proponer mejoras basadas en insights reales.
  • Ambiente colaborativo, con espacio para aprender y crecer en el mundo de producto digital.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that‚Äôs what we‚Äôre doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we‚Äôve still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

About The Position

As a Data Analyst, you'll be part of an exceptional team of over 30 SQL and data visualization specialists. Our Data Analytics department is organized around 11 problem spaces that mirror the structure of the entire company, ensuring that every decision we make at Cabify is data-driven.

In your day-to-day role, you'll work in a multidisciplinary squad with other disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Growth, and Operations. We also follow agile methodologies within each analytics group and foster an environment of knowledge and resource sharing among the department.

If you're passionate about managing large volumes of data, you'll be delighted to know we leverage two different data warehouses, Google BigQuery and Amazon Redshift, to perform intensive analysis thus maximizing operational efficiency.

We take pride in working with one of the largest Tableau Server platforms in Europe, where we share not only powerful analysis and visualizations but also Self Service Data Sources, making data accessible to the entire company.

You Will

Work in technical data projects autonomously to enhance the company's analytics capabilities through functions such as:


Exploit large-scale data warehouses performing efficient SQL.
Define ETL models in our datawarehouse with Airflow.
Document and maintain your code and queries in Gitlab.
Create dashboards and reports using Tableau / PowerBI to communicate results and monitor KPIs regularly.
Execute exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide action recommendations.
Present findings to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Work closely with engineers to define what data is needed for analysis, request creation of new app events, 3rd party integrations, collaborate in the data models design, granularity, and how they relate to existing models.
Help design new features alongside product managers and engineers, measuring their performance and testing their business impact.
Develop Data Sources to use across the organization, thus empowering business by exploring data in a trusted environment.


Our Ideal Candidate Has


Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of working experience as a Data Analyst
Experienced in writing and understanding complex SQL and working with large data sets
Working knowledge of Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, or any other data visualization tool
Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields
Fluency in English and Spanish


Bonus Points


A Master's degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar


What‚Äôs it like to work at Cabify?

We‚Äôre a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team

‚åöHybrid Model (2 work-from-home days per week plus 6 weeks per year)

üí∂Excellent Salary conditions: L2 [30-40K‚Ç¨]

üèùÔ∏èRecharge days

üåçOur office is located in Madrid.

‚åöFlexible work environment & hours.

üôåRegular team events.

üöóCabify staff free rides.

üöÄPersonal development programs based on our career paths.

üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è iFeel: Free access to the iFeel platform, so you can take care of your emotional well-being through therapy sessions.

üìêCoursera: your own license in Coursera to take as many courses as you wish and continue developing your skills.

üí≥Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare

üíªAll the equipment you need (you only have to bring your talent).

üê±A pet room, so you don‚Äôt have to leave your furry friend at home

‚òïÔ∏èAnd last but not least...free coffee and fruit!

Cabify is proud of being an equal-opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age, or ability.

Join us!

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in M√°laga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our M√°laga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

‚Ä¢ Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

‚Ä¢ Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

‚Ä¢ Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

‚Ä¢ Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

‚Ä¢ Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

‚Ä¢ Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

‚Ä¢ Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

‚Ä¢ Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

‚Ä¢ Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

‚Ä¢ Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

‚Ä¢ Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

‚Ä¢ Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

‚Ä¢ High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

‚Ä¢ Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

‚Ä¢ Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

‚Ä¢ Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

‚Ä¢ Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üÜô Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

üè† Hybrid Work

üí∞ Competitive compensation structure

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

üõü Life Insurance

üìà Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

üõ¨ Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Business & Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Would you like to work for a company where hospitality is a work of heart and you can be all you are?

Our purpose is to pioneer the art of responsible hospitality, connecting cultures with heartfelt care. With over 230,000 hospitality experts in more than 40+ hotel brands, we nurture a real passion for service and achievement beyond limits.

At the Accor Global Reservation Centre, we offer memorable experiences to our clients.

You will be part of an international team helping guests offering them the best experience when making the reservation in the luxury hotels around the world. You will be sharing your expertise and knowledge of our spectacular, world-class locations and properties while having authentic conversations with guests.

Job Description

Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst, where you'll turn complex data into actionable insights to drive business decisions and contribute to our organization's success

Job Purpose

As a Business and Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our center's business strategy, leveraging data insights to drive decision-making, optimize operations, and increase revenue. You will report directly to the hotel operations manager and oversee the WFM analyst activities.

In this role, you will focus on developing and enhancing Global Reservation Centre reporting and analyses, providing the foundation for informed business decisions. Your work will directly support operational improvements and revenue growth, making you a valuable contributor to our international and dynamic team.

Main Duties


Consolidate reporting requirements from different regions, hotels, and centers, and prepare recurring performance reports for various stakeholders
Analyze complex data, identify anomalies, and provide actionable insights to support decision-making
Guide business line contacts in asking the right questions to drive data-driven decisions through effective storytelling
Build and enhance Global Reservation Centre reporting and dashboards to monitor daily, weekly, and monthly operational performance
Manage the master database, ensure data quality from multiple sources, and collaborate with the central data team in Paris to automate processes.
Develop and refine key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and improve performance
Identify areas for improvement and propose innovative solutions to optimize processes (e.g., automation, operational efficiency, productivity)
Transform raw data into meaningful statistical insights
Stay up to date with new tools and technologies relevant to data analysis and reporting
Act as a business partner for the Global Reservation Centre, providing ad-hoc analyses to support strategic decision-making
Promote a positive working environment and champion Accor‚Äôs Culture, Mission, Vision, and Values
Ensure compliance with relevant rules and procedures


Qualifications

Skills:


Education and/or work experience in Business or Engineering school, specializing in Data, business analytics, and business strategy
Minimum 2 years work experience in a data-driven environment
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Deep knowledge of database languages (SQL); Excel (VBA will be a plus) and data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI), understanding the mechanism of CRM tools (Salesforce)
Familiarity with emerging technologies relevant to the industry positions analysts to adapt strategies to changing technological landscapes
Critical thinking, and solution-oriented, while being organized and structured
Agile and know how to adapt to different situations
Full business proficiency in English (written & verbal), a second/third language would be a plus
Hands-on and enjoy getting into the heart of the matter
Strong sense of responsibility and accountability
Respectful and collaborative within a diverse multicultural environment


What We Offer


A dynamic and supportive work environment.
Opportunities for career growth in a global organization.
Collaboration with a talented, international team.


Additional Information

If you are passionate about luxury and sales, and are looking for a role that values genuine interactions and exceptional guest experiences, apply now to become a Luxury Reservation Consultant with us. Let's create unforgettable experiences together.

Location and Availability Requirements:


Must be currently legally entitled to work full-time in Spain
39 working hours/ week
Current opening hours: Mon-Sun 8am to 10pm


Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit, and promote diverse talent.

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS

What It‚Äôs Like to Work at Accor Global Reservation Centre:

LK : Accor GRC Barcelona

IG : GRC Barcelona

TikTok : grc.barcelona
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft‚Äôs 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players‚Äô lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work from Home Policy‚ÄØand‚ÄØWFH Parent Policy: Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion


Required Qualifications


2 years experience
Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
Some knowledge and experience working with Python
Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker


About Electronic Arts

We‚Äôre proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Grupo Fertiberia is a major player in the plant nutrition sector in Europe and also produces environmental solutions for industry and other sectors. The company has 14 production centres spread across the Iberian Peninsula and France. Grupo Fertiberia¬¥s vision is to lead the green hydrogen value chain of the future in Europe to decarbonise agriculture and other sectors such as industry and transport, as well as to continue leading the development of sustainable solutions with high added value for crop nutrition. It is also the first company in its sector to commit to achieving zero net emissions by 2035.




The position will belong to Fertiberia Corporate and will be based in Madrid, with the possibility of occasional travel to one of the work centres of the group's companies.




We are looking for a Data Analyst reporting to the Data manager of de company. This person will be responsible for creating analysis, dashboards, and reports to support relevant decision-making by our Business Managers.




Key Responsibilities:




Learning and fully understanding the data landscape in databases.
Working closely with different stakeholders to identify their needs and gathering end user reporting and dashboard requirements.
Using and developing data from different areas.
Report and create different KPI‚Äôs.
Automatization of processes (RPA)
Supporting use of model outputs for decision making and insights.




Position requirements:




Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related field. A Master‚Äôs degree or relevant certification is preferred.
Specific training in: Data Management Tools and Power BI (It is a must); Data pre-processing techniques and data optimization.
Experience: At least 2 years of experience working with a high volume of information and with different data sources. Experience working or ability to work with predefined deadlines.
Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Proficiency in project management software and tools.
Attributes: The candidate must be an analytical, dynamic, innovative, quick learner, autonomous person, with the ability to work in transversal teams and push projects.
English: C1 level
Computer tools: Excel; Power BI; Proficiency in Power Apps, Power Automate and RPA tools knowledge.
Availability for immediate hiring
Willingness to travel occasionally




If you meet the requirements and consider yourself a person with initiative, results and internal customer oriented, this is your opportunity to join a leading group. Do not hesitate to apply! We are looking for you!




We are a company committed to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion, as well as personal and family balance. The selection process for this offer guarantees equal opportunities for all candidates without any distinction based on gender, disability, race, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

For more than 20 years, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftspeople has delivered cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of AI driven digital transformation. Since 2001, we have grown into a full service digital consulting company with 5500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition. Driven by the desire to make a difference, we keep innovating. Fuelling the growth of our company with our knowledge worker culture. When teaming up with Xebia, expect in-depth expertise based on an authentic, value-led, and high quality way of working that inspires all we do.




About the Role

We are looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualisation Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.




Responsibilities

Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.




Your background

3+ years of professional experience analysing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarise, and analyse data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. e-commerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team. This role offers a dynamic environment where you will have the opportunity to work on diverse data analysis tasks, collaborate with international colleagues, and develop your skills within a growing organization.




ABOUT THE JOB

We are looking for a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team. This role offers a dynamic environment where you will have the opportunity to work on diverse data analysis tasks, collaborate with international colleagues, and develop your skills within a growing organization




WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO AS A DATA ANALYST?

Collaborate daily with colleagues in Poland

Conduct both on-demand and scheduled data analyses

Create and maintain comprehensive reports

Organize and structure file systems effectively

Manage databases efficiently

Oversee internal and external data exchange processes

WHAT DO YOU BRING AS A DATA ANALYST?

Proficiency in Microsoft Excel with Power Add-ons

English language proficiency

Microsoft Access

Database management experience

University degree or ongoing studies in Mathematics, Business Analytics, Econometrics, or a related field

Travel Requirement: Visits to Poland at least four times a year (one week per visit)




ABOUT THE TEAM

If you are passionate about data, enjoy working in a collaborative environment, and seek opportunities for professional growth, we would love to hear from you!

Title: Business Intelligence Europe Trainee
Description:
UPL Limited is a global provider of sustainable agriculture products and solutions, with annual revenue exceeding $6bn. We are a purpose-led company. Through OpenAg¬Æ, UPL is focused on accelerating progress for the food system. We are building a network that is reimagining sustainability, redefining the way an entire industry thinks and works ‚Äì open to fresh ideas, innovation, and new answers as we strive towards our mission to make every single food product more sustainable. As one of the largest agriculture solutions companies worldwide, our robust portfolio consists of biologicals and traditional crop protection solutions with more than 14,000 registrations. We are present in more than 130 countries, represented by more than 10,000 colleagues globally.




That‚Äôs your opportunity! At UPL we are looking for a Business Intelligence Europe Trainee to join the Europe Marketing Department! The person will be based in Madrid or Barcelona and will collaborate with our Business Intelligence Europe team for a period of 6 to 12 months! Join us and make an impact!




Job Description:

Portfolio and Project data Management support.
Business data, collection and processing.
Support in analytics and data reporting.
Data warehouse and database maintenance.
Market data analysis.
Cross-functional data support and collaboration.




Qualifications and Skills:

Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in business analytics, data science, statistics, marketing, finance, business administration or equivalent combination of education.
Fluency in English (spoken and written).
Additional knowledge of other languages is a plus.
Good database management skills (Excel, Pivot Tables, I, others as plus, eg: Qlik, Power BI)
Ability to manage and interpret data, identify trend and provide insights.
Good communication skills.
Ability to work and collaborate in a multidisciplinary team.
Ability to be autonomous and fast learner.
Highly organized and able to work on several projects simultaneously.




Technical skills:

Excel skills (advanced functions, pivot tables and query handling), data visualization, dashboard creation and reporting (Qlik Sense, Power BI, Tableau) and comfortable working with large datasets and ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Experience in working with cloud-based data storage platforms, familiarity with data extraction, transformation and loading (ETL) processes and basic knowledge of SQL is a plus.




Notice to Recruiters and Staffing Agencies:

UPL and its affiliates and subsidiaries ("UPL") have an internal recruiting department. UPL may supplement that internal capability from time to time with assistance from temporary staffing agencies, placement services, and professional recruiters ("Agency"). Agencies should only contact UPL‚Äôs Human resources department (hereafter referred to as HR department) for staffing requirements at UPL which would present all candidates internally. Agency must obtain written approval from UPL's HR department before submitting resumes, and then only in conjunction with a valid fully executed contract for service and in response to a specific job opening will UPL pay the agreed upon service fees. UPL will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have such agreement in place.




Diversity&Inclusion at UPL:

UPL is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Open Digital Services is the software development company of Santander Group powering the next generation of banks by creating innovative banking products and implementing them in collaboration with Santander Group Affiliates.

Santander Group is one of the world's largest financial institutions and the Eurozone's leader, we're committed to being the best Digital Bank with Branches in the industry.

Our mission at ODS is to design and support an advanced digital and omnichannel platform, ensuring the best customer experience using cutting-edge technology. Openbank, our flagship partner, is where we develop our most advanced concepts first. Be part of our Best-in-Class team and help us create unique value for our customers!

Join us to tackle exciting tech challenges in an agile environment, benefiting from learning, growth, and local and international career opportunities in a modern, diverse setting.




Mission and responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a role in interpreting and analyzing complex data from various business areas. Your primary focus will be on leveraging advanced analytics techniques to uncover insights, identify trends, and drive data-driven decision-making processes.

The main tasks of this position will be the following:

Collect and interpret data from various sources within the AWS Datalake to generate actionable insights.
Analyze results from diverse commercial actions to identify opportunities for business optimization, leveraging advanced analytics techniques.
Develop end-to-end Machine Learning models to optimize business processes.
Communicate findings effectively through reports and data visualization tools.
Identify patterns and trends in datasets, automate routine tasks, and focus efforts on analyzing anomalous or unexpected patterns.
Design and implement new data collection and analysis processes tailored to business verticals such as Wealth and new geographic markets.
Locate and propose opportunities for process enhancements to improve efficiency and outcomes.
Develop and implement scripts or dashboards to streamline recurring tasks and support scalability.
Generate comprehensive documentation of all processes to ensure knowledge transfer, easy understanding, and secure backup.




To be successful in the role you must have:

+3 years of experience working on a team with experience understanding risk/ portfolio construction and analytics; predictive modelling, and Machine Learning applications.
University or Master‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science / Telecom. / Maths / Physics / Industrial engineer.
Strong programming skills for data analytics and Machine Learning/AI.
Strong Python and PySpark skills ‚Äì knowledge of data management.
Experience with SQL for managing and accessing data.
Familiarity with software development tools such as GitHub.
Excellent communication/ presentation skills, confidence, and ability to influence, coach, educate fundamental PMs. Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Interest in learning from other Data Science experts, using feedback to improve analysis and understanding of strategies.
Attention to detail and passion/ grit for getting things done, digging into problems, and helping develop solutions.
Sense of ownership and entrepreneurialism to grow business.
Strong knowledge and/or experience on project management, PMI Certification will be a plus.
Knowledge of the Agile framework.




What do we offer?

Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.




Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Show more

  • Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
  • Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
  • Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
  • Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
  • Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
  • Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Title: Business & Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Would you like to work for a company where hospitality is a work of heart and you can be all you are?

Our purpose is to pioneer the art of responsible hospitality, connecting cultures with heartfelt care. With over 230,000 hospitality experts in more than 40+ hotel brands, we nurture a real passion for service and achievement beyond limits.

At the Accor Global Reservation Centre, we offer memorable experiences to our clients.

You will be part of an international team helping guests offering them the best experience when making the reservation in the luxury hotels around the world. You will be sharing your expertise and knowledge of our spectacular, world-class locations and properties while having authentic conversations with guests.

Job Description

Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst, where you'll turn complex data into actionable insights to drive business decisions and contribute to our organization's success

Job Purpose

As a Business and Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our center's business strategy, leveraging data insights to drive decision-making, optimize operations, and increase revenue. You will report directly to the hotel operations manager and oversee the WFM analyst activities.

In this role, you will focus on developing and enhancing Global Reservation Centre reporting and analyses, providing the foundation for informed business decisions. Your work will directly support operational improvements and revenue growth, making you a valuable contributor to our international and dynamic team.

Main Duties


Consolidate reporting requirements from different regions, hotels, and centers, and prepare recurring performance reports for various stakeholders
Analyze complex data, identify anomalies, and provide actionable insights to support decision-making
Guide business line contacts in asking the right questions to drive data-driven decisions through effective storytelling
Build and enhance Global Reservation Centre reporting and dashboards to monitor daily, weekly, and monthly operational performance
Manage the master database, ensure data quality from multiple sources, and collaborate with the central data team in Paris to automate processes.
Develop and refine key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and improve performance
Identify areas for improvement and propose innovative solutions to optimize processes (e.g., automation, operational efficiency, productivity)
Transform raw data into meaningful statistical insights
Stay up to date with new tools and technologies relevant to data analysis and reporting
Act as a business partner for the Global Reservation Centre, providing ad-hoc analyses to support strategic decision-making
Promote a positive working environment and champion Accor‚Äôs Culture, Mission, Vision, and Values
Ensure compliance with relevant rules and procedures


Qualifications

Skills:


Education and/or work experience in Business or Engineering school, specializing in Data, business analytics, and business strategy
Minimum 2 years work experience in a data-driven environment
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Deep knowledge of database languages (SQL); Excel (VBA will be a plus) and data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI), understanding the mechanism of CRM tools (Salesforce)
Familiarity with emerging technologies relevant to the industry positions analysts to adapt strategies to changing technological landscapes
Critical thinking, and solution-oriented, while being organized and structured
Agile and know how to adapt to different situations
Full business proficiency in English (written & verbal), a second/third language would be a plus
Hands-on and enjoy getting into the heart of the matter
Strong sense of responsibility and accountability
Respectful and collaborative within a diverse multicultural environment


What We Offer


A dynamic and supportive work environment.
Opportunities for career growth in a global organization.
Collaboration with a talented, international team.


Additional Information

If you are passionate about luxury and sales, and are looking for a role that values genuine interactions and exceptional guest experiences, apply now to become a Luxury Reservation Consultant with us. Let's create unforgettable experiences together.

Location and Availability Requirements:


Must be currently legally entitled to work full-time in Spain
39 working hours/ week
Current opening hours: Mon-Sun 8am to 10pm


Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit, and promote diverse talent.

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS

What It‚Äôs Like to Work at Accor Global Reservation Centre:

LK : Accor GRC Barcelona

IG : GRC Barcelona

TikTok : grc.barcelona
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft‚Äôs 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players‚Äô lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work from Home Policy‚ÄØand‚ÄØWFH Parent Policy: Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
¬†
The Story so far: Who we are


Founded in August 2020, Huspy started as a digital mortgage platform and quickly evolved into the largest proptech company in the EMEA region. Backed by leading investors such as Sequoia, Balderton, Founders Fund, and Olayan, we have experienced rapid growth with offices in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Madrid, and Valencia. Our mission is to revolutionize the real estate industry by building an all-in-one super app designed to empower agents and mortgage brokers.




The Main Event: What you'll do¬†




Our Data team is at the heart of our decision-making, providing the insights and infrastructure to fuel growth and innovation. Join us to play a vital role in transforming data into actionable intelligence at Huspy!




You‚Äôll join Huspy‚Äôs Data team as a Data Analyst with a focus on Business Intelligence, where you‚Äôll support business units by delivering actionable insights and creating impactful reports. Your work will be crucial in helping teams make data-driven decisions, optimize performance, and align with Huspy‚Äôs business objectives. You will take ownership of BI tools and dashboards, ensuring data quality and reliability for stakeholders across the organization.




Responsibilities:





Develop and Maintain BI Dashboards: Design, build, and maintain dashboards and reports in Tableau (preferred) or similar BI tools, ensuring they provide clear and actionable insights for business stakeholders.


Data Extraction and Analysis: Use SQL and other data extraction tools to gather, clean, and analyze data from various sources, including Snowflake.


Collaborate with Stakeholders: Work closely with business, product, and engineering teams to understand their data needs, translating business questions into analytical requirements and solutions.


Optimize Reporting: Continuously enhance reporting systems for scalability and efficiency, ensuring reports are easy to access, interpret, and act upon.


Support Data-Driven Decisions: Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support decision-making and performance optimization.


Ensure Data Quality: Implement quality checks and maintain data accuracy across BI systems, working with data engineering to resolve any data issues.


Document BI Processes: Create and maintain documentation for BI processes, data definitions, and dashboard usage guidelines to support consistency and transparency.





The Perfect Match: What you bring





Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics). A Master‚Äôs degree is a plus.


Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analytics or BI-focused role.


BI and Visualization Expertise: Strong proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau (preferred), Power BI, or Looker, with the ability to create visually compelling and easy-to-navigate dashboards.


Technical Proficiency: Advanced SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation; familiarity with data platforms like Snowflake (preferred) is beneficial.


Data Analysis and Reporting Skills: Experience in conducting data analysis and generating insights to support business needs, including KPI tracking and performance reporting.


ETL Skills: Familiarity with ETL processes for data preparation, ensuring clean, accurate, and well-organized data for analysis.


Attention to Detail: Strong commitment to accuracy, with the ability to identify and correct data discrepancies.


Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex findings clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Collaborative Spirit: Experience working cross-functionally, especially with product, engineering, and business teams to align data insights with business strategies.





What will set you apart





Experience with Our Tool Stack: Hands-on experience with Tableau, Snowflake, dbt, and Airflow is a strong plus.


Advanced Analytical Knowledge: Proficiency in Python or R for advanced data analysis and modeling.


Experience in Data-Driven Organizations: Previous experience in a fast-paced, data-centric environment where BI plays a strategic role in decision-making.


Business Acumen: Strong understanding of business processes, KPIs, and metrics relevant to the PropTech or startup sector.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion


Required Qualifications


2 years experience
Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
Some knowledge and experience working with Python
Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker


About Electronic Arts

We‚Äôre proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Finance)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who don't believe there's a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Supporting the Finance team in controlling market products, including market making and treasury investments
Analysing and optimising financial control and treasury management activities
Understanding business processes through financial data and ensuring accuracy from booking to accounting
Developing Price Verification Models to ensure accurate valuation of financial products
Automating financial controls to improve efficiency and compliance
Designing and implementing reconciliation logic for balance accuracy
Creating and maintaining dashboards to track key financial metrics
Collaborating with Market Making, Treasury, and Financial Control teams to enhance reporting and decision-making


What You'll Need


5+ years of experience working with Data Analysis and creating impactful solutions
Ability to manage a team and stakeholders
Excellent background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Previous experience working on a Finance department


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Logistics at full potential










We are currently looking for a talented and passionate certified Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.







Reporting to the Contract Director, you will be working closely with an international team in Europe conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. You will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. You will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.







Location: Marchamalo










What you will do:







Collect, interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics techniques and models, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases / data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Identify and define new process improvement opportunities
Collect, interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics techniques and models, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases / data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Identify and define new process improvement opportunities







Required Education and Experience







To be successful in this role it is essential that you have the following skills:







Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models and database design development.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages and BI tools (Business Objects, Microstrategy, Power BI, etc.), databases (Oracle, DB2, etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.)
Strong technical knowledge of MS Excel.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Preferred Education: Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
Language skills: English B2 or more
Preferible: Technical knowledge of SaaS cloud environments (AWS or Azure)
